strIntroduction: Itinerary : Sunset & Sunrise Camping : At 1717 meters , “Mount Batur Volcano” is the 2nd highest point of Bali. To get the most out of this hike, we need a two day-one night to experience Sunset, Sunrise, mountain caving, etc. In this way we are able to have an incredible camping experience, we will spend a night on top of Mount Batur. We start in the afternoon at about 3 pm from our base at Toya Bungkah Village. The hike will take you about 2 hours depends on the amount of hikers and their physical condition. We will set up our tents when we reach 1500 meters above sea level. At approximately 6pm, we will take in the sunset at the peak of the volcano 1717 meters above sea level. The hike from the camping ground to sunset view will take you 14 to 20 minutes. While you are enjoying the sunset view you will be served simple meal (often banana cooked with the steam of the volcano) with hot Bali Coffee and tea. After watching the sunset we will head back to the camping ground to prepare our dinner. We will cook dinner and make a nice campfire. Some wine (locally known as Arak Bali and Brem) is poured around and we make a toast for a clear day and safe return. On full moon nights, it is incredible and on the dark moon you will be able to see more stars than you have ever seen before. The next day we will wake up a little earlier than your regular time. All of the hiking and camping gears should be packed before the coming of the other tourists who hike the volcano to see the sunrise. These gear will be taken care of by our potter. The morning sights are amazing. When the sun starts to rise, beautiful colors of purple, orange, pink and red appear. The sky slowly changes from black to blue while the clouds dissipate and re-form due to the temperature changes caused by the rising sun. This is the best moment to see the oceans. It is hard to put into words how amazing it is to watch this new day begin. You may have seen sunrises before, but surely few compare to one witnessed at the top of Mt. Batur. On a clear day we can easily see Mount Rinjani on Lombok Island. After watching the sunrise, the hike continues and we will explore the 3 main craters of the volcano. This hiking will also take you to the recent black lava flow. This Journey will be completed at Batur Natural Hot Spring. Relax and recharge your mind at this natural hot spring. --------------------------------------------------------------------------- Equipment provided by the brand EIGER® : - Tent for 2 persons or 1 person - Sleeping Bag - Backpack - Warm Jacket - Trekking Poles - Head Torches
strTitle: Camp Overnight atop Mt. Batur and see the Sunset & Sunrise

strIntroduction: Have you ever wondered what is it like dining with your beloved in your own private cave with the sound of the waves crashing the shore, and the ocean breeze serenading around you? Live the experience of luxury romantic dining on your own private beach with your team of butler, dedicated chefs and waiting staff serving you a delicious five-course meal while you relax to the natural beauty around you. The romantic mood for the night is set when you climb down 120 stairs to reach your cave hideaway. Surprise your sweetheart with the mystery feeling of discovering your own spot together. It's a place fit for conversations galore and creating memories. Menu *The Power of Love* A Marriage of Prawn and Alaskan Crab on Organic Greens with Cocktail Sauce and Oscietra caviar *Sentimental Reason* A Roasted Organic Tomato and Onion Broth with fresh Basil and Oysters *True, Badly, Deeply* Fruit of the Sea and Prime Cuts Barbeque with Variety of Sauces, Baked Potato and Vegetables *Sweet Love Symphony* A Combination of Two of Samabe’s Most Famous Recipes *Bouquet of Joy* Black and White Mini Chocolate Tartlets Samabe’s signature romantic You can also request us for the following add-ons: - A message in a bottle (love message in an antique bottle, a bottle of champagne, fresh strawberry and 20 red roses) - Flower bouquet - Veuve Clicquot Yello Label Champagne - Rose petals - Solo guitarist
strTitle: Romantic Private Cave Dinner on a Secluded Beach in Nusa Dua

strIntroduction: We pamper you with five-star service and give you a choice of 2 menus to choose from. Whether you're celebrating a birthday, an anniversary or even proposing to your significant other, let our private pavilion serve as the location for a special night in Bali. Below are the 2 menus for you to choose from. We can accommodate special requests, though, so just let us know what you need and we will make it happen! If you would like to see the light change over the rice paddies in the evening, we suggest an early start time of 6.30pm. MENU A: -Welcome Cocktail -Home Made Bread -Appetizer - Deep fried rolled crepes minced beef, served with avocado mint mousse and yogurt dressing -Sherbert -Grilled marinated pork chop served with parsley potatoes, baby corn and sautéed fresh mushroom with prawn and rosemary juice or -Grilled imported beef tenderloin with sautéed vegetables, butter rice and black pepper sauce -Carrot Orange Cake with cream cheese frosting and orange clove apple sauce MENU B -Welcome Cocktail -Home Made Bread - Soup Ayam Jamur - Chicken and fresh shiitake mushrooms with chicken broth -Sherbert - Grilled Australian beef tenderloin wrapped with roasting bacon, served with Balinese vegetables, garlic sweet potato and yellow nutmeg Balinese sauce or - Grilled prawn in Balinese red sauce with fresh vegetables, Balinese mashed potatoes, sweet corn rice and prawn crackers - Biu Metunu with vanilla ice cream - Roasted banana and caramelized palm sugar, coconut milk, grated coconut and vanilla ice cream
strTitle: Romantic Candlelight Dinner Overlooking the Rice Paddies

strIntroduction: If you're looking for something deeply meaningful during your trip to Bali, this cleansing and spiritual tour will help you understand your past, present, future, fortune, love life, career, health, and other aspects of your life. In addition to a consultation with an experienced healer, I will bring you to bathe in water direct from the holy spring to help release all negative things from your body. Itinerary for the day: - Consultation with the shaman healer. You can ask about your future, your relationships, and whatever else you would like to know (30 - 45 minutes per person). - Visit the spring water temple Tampaksiring and get dressed for the purification ritual. I will prepare the offerings for you to place in the temple and seek permission for you to join the locals and take part in the ritual. I will also explain every step of the process (time taken depends on how busy it is at the temple) - Afterwards, change into a local Balinese dress, and continue on with the procession to the main part of the temple to give one last prayer and drink the holy water from the priest as a blessing. - Leave for lunch around the temple grounds. I will bring you to try some local food. If you wish to eat something else for lunch instead, we can also find suitable restaurants nearby. ***Please note: If you wish to have an appointment please select the "additional palm reader" option as an add-on to your booking. Appointments must be made with at least 24 hours notice.
strTitle: Take Part in a Spiritual Cleansing Ritual in Bali

strIntroduction: If you've always wanted to see fireflies (or as we call them in Bali 'Kunang-kunang'), this special night tour is a must-do during your trip to Bali. In Ubud, fireflies can be seen in their natural habitat, especially in unspoiled and unpolluted rice fields, far away from crowded areas. Unfortunately, places like these are becoming more rare as urbanization and the population in Bali increases, placing the fireflies in Ubud at risk of losing their homes. On this special night tour, we've handpicked a few locations and bring you to 2-3 during the evening so you get to soak in the evening atmosphere in remote and peaceful villages. During our time together, you will learn about the behavior and uniqueness of these insects. While enjoying the twinkling lights of fireflies, you will also hear the other sounds of the countryside, with crickets, frogs, gecko, etc in the distance. We also teach about the rice paddies & harvest cycle, subak irrigation system, ducks, and animals. Our itinerary: 17.00 - 18.30: Pickup from your hotel 19.00: Dinner at a local restaurant in Ubud - an a la carte menu with a choice of chicken, fish or duck cooked with Balinese spices will be served. 20.30 - 22.30: Fireflies tour. 22.30: Depart from Ubud for your hotel. Arrival will be around 11.30pm Let the glow of the fireflies give you an unforgettable experience during your trip to Bali!
strTitle: Ubud Fireflies Tour - A Countryside Adventure

strIntroduction: Whether you are coming straight from the airport or from another destination in Bali, come hide away in the countryside with this romantic getaway designed for two. Our friendly driver will come to collect you from any point you desire and will whisk you away to our favorite place in Bali - the charming village of Sidemen. Time seems to slow down in this unique spiritual pace. You have to experience it to understand what we mean! Our signature drink of rosella tea will welcome you upon your arrival and you can spend that first day relaxing by our pool and soaking in the soothing atmosphere of the area. That first evening, we serve up our signature Rijsttafel feast so you can both try a number of delectable side dishes that are uniquely Balinese. Fall asleep that evening to the sounds of nature as you ease into your rejuvenating holiday with us. The next day, after enjoying a healthy breakfast, go on a leisurely trek with our local guide as he brings you to cross several shallow rivers and takes you up some of Bali's most beautiful rice terraces. Marvel at the majestic Mount Agung, the tallest peak on the island, which towers over it all. No jostling tourists here, just friendly locals greeting you with a smile. Back at the villa, a refreshing young coconut awaits, before you tuck into a healthy and light lunch at our restaurant overlooking local farms. Later that afternoon, a 90 minute traditional Balinese massage is prepared for you in our spa pavilion overlooking the countryside, so you get to relax completely while you enjoy the sounds of nature. This spa session is followed with a delicious afternoon tea featuring traditional Balinese farmer sweets and delicacies such as Laklak (a rice flour pancake with palm sugar syrup), Godoh (fried banana fritters), boiled peanuts, sweet potatoes, and sweet corn. The tea is flexible, so you can have it anywhere you'd like! Before dinner, we draw sensual herbal bath for the both of you, using herbs and essential oils such as lavender, tea tree and ylang ylang and combining this heavenly combination with flowers for that ultra-romantic touch. The romance continues with a candlelight dinner under the stars, featuring a special menu from our chef using aphrodisiac ingredients such as chocolate and ginger. Paired with a bottle of local wine, you can toast to an incredible weekend in the countryside! Day 1: Afternoon: Arrival at Cepik Villa 16.00: Afternoon tea in a location of your choosing 19.00: Rijsttafel dinner in our terrace restaurant Day 2: 06.00: Healthy breakfast 07.00: Morning rice field and village trek with our local guide 12.00: Lunch in our terrace restaurant overlooking the rice paddies 14.00: 90 minute exotic Balinese Massage 16.00: Afternoon tea in a location of your choosing 18.00: Herbal Bath 19.00: Aphrodisiac Candlelight dinner Day 3 Morning: Healthy breakfast Get ready for departure NOTE: The price for this retreat depends on the time of year, so select your option accordingly: High Season: Dec 23 - Jan 10 Peak Season: July 1 - Sept 15 Low season: All other dates MENUS - We are happy to cater for various diets: - Vegan menu for strict vegetarians: sweet potatoes, sauteed vegetables and fruits. - For those looking for a Satvikk diet, we provide calming food that excludes garlic, onions, shallots and of course meats, poultry and fish. - Our regular breakfast menu includes Indonesian favorites as well as an American breakfast consisting of toast, jam/preserves, honey, two eggs(any style), bacon or sausages, juices and coffee or tea. Possible Add-on: Yoga class for 2 pax at 45USD / person (please add to your order when booking)
strTitle: Honeymoon Package: 2 Night Romantic Retreat in Sidemen, Bali

strIntroduction: There’s no better way to spend a tropical evening in Bali than on Bali Hai’s Sunset Dinner Cruise. Watch the colors of the sky change from just a hint of a colour to shades of deeper orange, purple and red while you cruise along the harbor sipping a drink on the open-air top deck of the Bali Hai II. Enjoy the sunset usually only seen on beautiful pictures. This time it is you making the magnificent photographs and memories that will last a lifetime. As the sun goes down we set off on a relaxing cruise around Benoa Harbour in South Bali aboard our luxury catarmaran, Bali Hai II. As you take in the cool night air on the top deck you will be entertained by our live musical entertainers. This is followed by a delicious international buffet dinner before you can dance the night away at our disco or enjoy our live cabaret show. Our Bali Hai Sunset Dinner Cruise is suitable for the whole family so bring the kids along to enjoy the party. ITINERARY: Arrival to Benoa Harbour 17.30: Board our Catamaran 17.45: Our catamaran departs 17.50 - 18:30: Drinks and sunset on the top deck 18.30: Buffet Dinner opens on the main (1st) deck 19.45: Buffet Dinner closes on the main (1st) deck, dessert still available until 20:15 pm. 19.50: Cabaret show begins on the main deck and live musicians play on the bridge deck. 20.30: Cabaret show ends, DJ takes over the sound system for some dancing. 20.45: Our catamaran returns alongside the jetty Return transfer to hotel / accommodation. BUFFET MENU (note that this is Halal) - Starters: Selection of Canapés, Soup of the day, Bread rolls, Butter - Salads: Dill mustard potato salad, Greek salad, Cooked Prawn Salad, California Sushi Rolls, Tuna and Glass Noodle Salad, Red Cabbage and apple salad, Cucumber Feta Cheese Salad - Hot main courses: Beef rendang (beef curry with coconut milk), Whole Fish in Hoisin Sauce, Meat Ball and Bow Tie Pasta, Deep fried chicken with honey lemon sauce, Chicken Tandoori - Seasonal vegetables, Steam rice, Shrimp crackers - Desserts: Whole fruits (mixed), Sliced fresh fruit, Assortment of pastries, Jajan pasar (local delicacies), Fruit pies, Cheese crackers, Selection of cheeses. PICK UP TIMES: 16.15 - 16.30: Ubud / Uluwatu / Tanah Lot 16.30 - 16.45: Seminyak / Legian / Kuta / Tuban / Canggu 16.45 - 17.00: Nusa Dua /Jimbaran 17.00 - 17.15: Sanur
strTitle: Bali Before Sunset Dinner Cruise By Bali Hai Cruises

strIntroduction: If you'd like to see Bali from a whole new angle, come try the aerial tours we've designed that show you the very best of Bali. Take in a bird's eye view of smoking volcanoes, highland lakes, stepped rice fields, remote beaches, towering cliffs, famous surf breaks and thousand year-old temples. Bali Adventure Sky Tours operates with best pilots and engineers - 7 days a week, all year round, we give you a bird’s eye view of Bali’s stunning scenery, to areas not accessible by road. We take you to great heights in the world's most beautiful archipelago. Experience the FUN and EXCITEMENT of a 5 Star Helicopter flight in our sleek Airbus Eurocopter B2 Helicopter complete with air conditioning, luxury leather interior and a state of the art internal and external camera system giving passengers a service never before seen in Bali. Our 4 state-of-the-art Heliports around Bali, are owned and operated by Bali Adventure Tours, enabling a heli combination with other adventure tours and for AIRPORT TRANSFERS combining our helicopterwith our own luxury VIP transport company, ensures no pickup or flight delays. Helicopter ride options are below (see price options in drop down box on the right). If you have any special requests including marriage proposals, wedding flights and aerial photography tours, let us know and we'd be happy to work something out for you! SHARED FLIGHTS: (Transport by car is not included) * We will need a minimum of 4 people to fly so we will do our best to combine your booking with another one. If there is no other bookings you can either cancel your booking or book the private flight 1. Kintamani Volcano/Beratan Lake Flight (25 minutes) (Every Wednesday and Saturday) Fly to the breathtaking volcanic crater of Mt. Batur or opt for the most famous volcano lakes Beratan/Buyan/Tamblingan. Both trips are absolutely breath-taking. The Batur crater is the remains of a huge explosion that occurred thousands of years ago. The small volcano is constantly recreating itself in periodic eruptions of ash and rock. The Beratan lake host the most famous Bali temple which you will have a chance to see from the above. The return journey to the Heliport takes us via Ubud villages over river gorges and beautiful rice fields. FULLY PRIVATE FLIGHTS : (land transfer is included) 1. Tanah Lot + coastline (25 minutes) - every day from 7am - 5.30pm This is a panoramic flight of the west and south coasts of Bali that highlights the beaches of Kuta and Legian, the mysterious Tanah Lot temple, and remarkable rice terraces. Tanah Lot temple was founded in 1481 AD by a famous Hindu priest Dang Hyang Nirartha. It is situated in the ocean, and can only be reached during low tide. The temple has a reputation for being dangerous, partly due to the many poisonous snakes that live in the surrounding caves. It is believed by the locals that these snakes are protectors of the temples, guarding it from intruders. We proceed towards the southern Bukit Peninsula, pass Jimbaran bay and Dreamland surf beach. Then we fly onwards to the ancient Uluwatu temple, where the coastline of limestone cliffs, remote beaches and seaweed farms are truly spectacular. 2. Kintamani Private flight (25 min) Fly to the breathtaking volcanic crater of Mt. Batur or opt for the most famous volcano lakes Beratan/Buyan/Tamblingan. Both trips are absolutely breath-taking. The Batur crater is the remains of a huge explosion that occurred thousands of years ago. The small volcano is constantly recreating itself in periodic eruptions of ash and rock. The Beratan lake host the most famous Bali temple which you will have a chance to see from the above. The return journey to the Heliport takes us via Ubud villages over river gorges and beautiful rice fields. 3. Sundowner Private Flight (25 minutes) As the sun goes down experience an exciting panoramic flight of Bali's famous coastline, highlighting the beautiful white sandy beaches. Wind down your day by flying above taking in the sight of Tanah Lot temple, the famous Kuta Beach, Jimbaran bay, Dreamland surf break, Uluwatu temple and the spectacular cliffs and seaweed farms of Bali's southern Peninsula. 4. Best of Bali Private Flight (60 minutes) A ‘must do’ tour during your Bali Holiday! Fly via the famous Kuta Beach coastline, passing Tanah Lot temple along the West coast to the breathtaking volcanic crater of Mount Batur. Lake Batur, Bali's largest lake, is situated within this crater, next to a young active volcano. We explore this sometimes smoking volcano by circling the crater. The return journey takes you over Ubud highlighting the village, its river gorges and the beautiful patterns of the rice fields. 5. Gili Islands (Lombok) Tour (45 minutes) As we fly along the east coast of Bali, you will be able to see Bali's most sacred mountain - Mount Agung - to your left and one of Bali's neighboring islands - Nusa Lembongan - to your right. As we approach Gili T, Mount Rinjani, Indonesia's second highest volcano, can be seen close by on neighboring Lombok dominating the views towards the East. 6. Private transfer to Nusa Lembongan (15 minutes) This 15 min flight (one way) from Bali to Nusa Lembongan will help you get there in the quickest and most efficient manner, so you have the rest of the day to explore the island. If you would like to enjoy the same helicopter ride back to Bali, please book this one-way transfer twice. ******************************* NOTE: - The start time for your private charter is full flexible as long as we have availability. When going through the booking process, please note the start time you would prefer to fly at so we can then advise you on the appropriate pick up time at your hotel (complimentary round trip transfer is offered to guests staying in Nusa Dua, Jimbaran, Kuta, Legian and Sanur). - Please be ready at your hotel on time so that you can be at the Heliport at least 30 minutes prior to your departure time to watch the instructional safety video - Since chartering a helicopter and pilots is subject to high direct costs, being late for more than 30 min is considered as a no-show and, thus, no refund policy applies.
strTitle: Bali Helicopter Tours - Be Amazed by Breathtaking Views!

strIntroduction: The program of White Water rafting down the Telaga Waja River offer a morning trip that will give special insight into the lives of the farmers that are working on their lands or rice fields. In the area of Kecamatan Rendang Kabupaten Karangasem, where runs one of the longest rivers in Bali called Telaga Waja. A favorite river for a soft adventure of white water rafting. Enjoy the thrill of rafting on Telaga Waja river combined with nature and culture sightseeing and special ambiance of Bali villages. Our professionally trained and experienced rafting guides will be happy to serve you and explain everything you need to know. Life jackets, helmets, and paddles will make you more comfortable and confident. Our white water rafting tour can be safely experienced by anyone who feels adventurous. So what you are waiting for? Come and join us! PICK UP TIMES : NUSA DUA/JIMBARAN : 07.30-08.00 KUTA AREA : 08.00-08.30 SANUR : 08.30-09.00 UBUD : 08.00-08.30 Activity Schedule: 07.30-08.30 : Pickup at your hotel 09.30-10.00 : Arrive at start point 10.15 : Welcome drink 10.15-10.30 : Guest briefing 10.30-13.30 : Rafting 13.30-14.30 : Lunch 14.30 : Back to your hotel 16.00 : Arrive at your hotel lobby

strIntroduction: OUR PROPOSED ITINERARY: 10.00 : Depart from your hotel 11.00 : Taman Ayun Temple - a Royal Temple of the Mengwi empire 12.30 : Lake Beratan & its beautiful lake temple with a breathtaking mountain backdrop 13.15 : Visit Candi Kuning Market - a traditional fruit and flower market 14.00 : Lunch at Pacung restaurant with magnificent rice terrace views 16.00 : Jatiluwih Rice Terraces (a UNESCO World Heritage Site) 17.30 : Tanah Lot Temple for sunset 20.00 : Arrive at your hotel While there are many guides in Bali for you to choose from, rest assured that your comfort is our no. 1 priority and we reassure all our guests of the following: 1. This tour is for 10 hours and is fully customizable. We are more than happy to adjust your itinerary to include or exclude anything you'd like. It is our usual policy to dive deeper into your itinerary when we pick you up from your hotel so everyone is happy with the plan for the day. With our wealth of experience heading to all the major sightseeing spots on the island, we will ensure that your journey is as smooth as possible. 2. There will be absolutely NO forced shopping on our tours. Other guides in Bali might offer you low prices upfront to secure your booking but then proceed to bring you on a merry-go-round of stores to earn commission from your purchases. We do not play such games with our guests. Should you do decide to go shopping of your own accord, there is no pressure to buy whatsoever. 3. You will be guided by an experienced licensed guide from our team who is fluent in English. We know that clear communication from our guides is key for guests to have a fruitful experience in Bali. As such, we go to great lengths to ensure that your guides have the requisite level of English (as well as experience) to guide you through your day comfortably.

strIntroduction: Wood carving is one of the very popular things you will see in Bali. The local style is very unique and beautiful. And it's not as difficult as it seems to! I am a professional wood carver for many years. I would love to show you how it's done, teach you the basics, and help you make your own piece of wood carving. You can choose what you would like to make, depending on your preference and skill. I can teach anybody - from beginner to professional. You will learn that wood carving is actually a fun activity, and that everyone can try it. And instead of buying expensive souvenirs, you will have one - to keep by yourself or as a gift for someone you care.
strTitle: Wood Carving with a Professional

strIntroduction: Kawah Ijen volcano (2386m) is an active stratovolcano located on the eastern part of Java Island. The top of Ijen volcano is characterized by a very acidic crater lake containing 27.5 million m³ of turquoise-colored water. This lake is the biggest reservoir of hot and acidic water on Earth. On the southern part of the lake, fumaroles are ejecting tons of sulfur every day. At night, this site is one of the only spot on Earth where it is possible to see blue fires. This is due to very hot gas coming from the volcanic conduits burning the sulfur, which leads to an extremely beautiful scenery. On the western part of the crater, a dam was build hundred years ago upstream of the Banyu Pahit river. We'll start from your hotel in Bali (Kuta, Seminyak, Nusa Dua, Sanur, or Ubud) between 06.30 – 07.00 PM. Our team will take you to the most western tip of Bali to reach Gilimanuk ferry port for about 6 hours by a private car with AC. From the harbor, we will take a ferry to cross Bali strait for about 1,5 hours to reach Ketapang ferry port of Banyuwangi in the most eastern tip of Java Island. Then At 01:00 AM (early morning), We will use 4WD vehicle (Jeep) to go to the village of Licin with english local guide and then continue to the slope of Mount Ijen, passing through plantations and rainforest. This is one of the few remaining on the island of Java with giant ferns and plants, big trees, this journey takes approximately an hour from Banyuwangi city. Arriving at the parking area of Mount Ijen. Approximately 1 until 1.5 hours will be required to ascend slope of mount Ijen to reach peak of Ijen Crater and along the path, You will enjoy the blue fire. Resting on the edge of the crater at an altitude of 2883 meters and enjoy best panorama of the lake of sulphate where reflects spectacular view in the surrounding walls to give the impression like doom. The sulfur mining workers go down into the crater and climb back up by passing dangerous path on the edge of Ijen Crater with the load as much as 80 kilograms on their shoulders. You will also enjoy the beautiful scenery in the crater of Ijen as one of God’s amazing creation. Do not forget to take pictures in this area as a proof that you have visited one of the most amazing places on earth. After You enjoyed the natural scenery at Crater of Ijen and then descend the slope of Mount Ijen until vehicles parking area where our vehicle is waiting for escort you to the local restaurant for having breakfast. Afterward, we will drive back to the Bali island with same route. We will arrive at your Bali hotel in the afternoon.
strTitle: Kawah Ijen (Mount Ijen) Blue Fire Volcano Crater Tour

strIntroduction: If you're curious to see what a Balinese family compound looks like, come and join my family in our traditional compound to cook our island's most famous dish. In addition to learning how locals cook this dish, you are welcome to interact with the community and spend time with my family! The location is in Batuyang village, which is a centre of sandalwood carving, about 30 minutes from central Ubud and Sanur. We make this dish just like we make at home, so it is 100% local! ITINERARY: 07.30 - 08.00 : Pick up at your hotel 08.30: Stop by our home for a quick break (to meet other participants if there are any) 08.40: Leave for our local market in Sukawati 09.00 - 09.20: Shop for spices and other ingredients like vegetables for our meal 09.30: Arrive back at our home and start cooking - chopping the vegetables, preparing the spices, marinating the pig 10.00: We start roasting the pig. We will show you the correct technique to baste the pig continuously - adding turmeric, coconut water and oil to make the skin extra crispy. In the meantime we also teach you to prepare all the other dishes. 12.00: Enjoy your lunch 13.30: Leave for your hotel Other dishes we will prepare: - Lawar (traditional mixed vegetables with fresh coconut and minced meat that accompany the Babi Guling) - Jukut ares - traditional soup made from banana trunk - Pisang rai - boiled banana with palm sugar and shredded coconut or - Pisang goreng - fried banana We will also serve you coffee or tea during this experience. PICK UP TIME Sanur/Ubud: 08.00 Kuta/Legian/Seminyak Jimbaran/Nusa Dua: 07.30
strTitle: Cook Babi Guling in a Local Balinese Compound Near Ubud

strIntroduction: Only Bali Adventure Tours offers this exclusive stretch of unexplored part of Ayung river in a choice of two daily rafting sessions over 33 rapids where you will travel through formerly unseen river splendor on the first section of the tour with daring, exciting and challenging new rapids to add to the thrill of Bali’s longest white water rafting trip. The class 2 & 3 rapids include encounters on vortexes of swirling and funneled waters, natural ramps and sudden drops in elevation and adrenaline pumping action which can be safely experienced by anyone from 5-65 years of age. ITINERARY FOR MORNING SESSION 09.00 Arriving at the Ubud Adventure & Function Centre Registration Process, Bracelet Distribution and Storing Valueable Items at Locker and Change for Rafting 09.30 Shuttle to Start Point of Rafting Outfitting and Briefing from the Guide 10.00 Rafting 12.00 Finish Rafting 12.15 Shower and Changes, Purchase Photos & DVD (additional charge) 12.30 Lunch at The Canopy 13.30 Depart from Ubud Adventure & Function Centre PICKUP times for MORNING session Nusa Dua 07.00 - 07.30 am Kuta/Seminyak 07.00 - 07.30 am Sanur 07.30 - 08.00 am Ubud 08.15 - 08.45 am PICKUP times for AFTERNOON session Nusa Dua 11.30 - 12.00 pm Kuta/Seminyak 11.30 - 12.00 pm Sanur 12.00 - 12.30 pm Ubud 12.30 - 01.00 pm
strTitle: White Water Rafting Ayung, Bali Adventure Tours

strIntroduction: Parasailing, also known as parascending, is a recreational activity where a person is towed behind a boat while attached to a specially designed parachute, known as a parasail. The boat then drives off, carrying the parascender into the air. Enjoy a panoramic view of the open skies and wide seas of Bali from high up in the air! Please add your transportation pickup service if you need private pickup and return transfer to your hotel from the option menu.
strTitle: Go Parasailing in Bali

strTitle: Tour around Bali and see its most iconic sights on a Scooter

strIntroduction: This trekking experience is designed for people who would like a deeper insight into the fascinating culture of Bali and the serene yet magnificent surrounding that it lives and breathes in. During this rice terrace trek, our professional and experienced guide will lead you through the traditional Balinese compound and witness the daily life of the Balinese family, walk through a peaceful village and enjoy Bali's fertile region. It will highlight the heritage and age-old agricultural practice and complicated design of the Balinese irrigation system (subak). We sincerely hope that through this trek our guests understand how and where the local people of this region forge their simple existence. BRIEF ITINERARY - The trek starts from the gorgeous river -valley of Sayan, Ubud. Our trekking guide will pick you up at the lobby hotel, then drive you to our private restaurant to enjoy the local breakfast. After breakfast our local guide will lead you to discover amazing historical sites, visit an ancient temple and simply enjoy the natural beauty of the Bongkasa rice terraces, Ayung river valley and distant mountains. We will also cross a charming and rustic bamboo bridge to cross the Ayung river. Trek Duration - 4 hours Trek Distance - 7 KM Lunch will served at the end of the tour at 12 noon in our private garden Balinese compound. PICK UP TIMINGS - Nusa Dua, Jimbaran area: 7.00 am - return 3.00 pm Kuta , Seminyak, Canggu area: 7.00 am - return 2.30 pm Ubud area: 7.30 am - return 2.00 pm
strTitle: Bali Rice Terrace Trekking Tour

strIntroduction: Join my husband and I for a full day of food and fun in a traditional family compound. Morning class starts at 8.30am (includes market tour) Afternoon class starts at 4pm (excludes market tour) The morning portion of our day starts out with a stroll through the colorful Ubud market, where the locals gather to buy their produce. I will show you the fresh array of herbs and spices, vegetables and meat available, and you will get to taste some delicious Balinese snacks and cakes, as well as marvel at the variety of flowers on sale. Next, we take a short ride back to my home village in Laplapan (a quick 10-minute drive from central Ubud), stopping at a scenic rice field along the way to show you how rice is grown. Upon arrival at my home, you can enjoy a refreshing welcome drink as my husband Wayan and I explain how Balinese families live in a traditional family compound. After this explanation, we continue our culinary journey with a tour of my herb garden, and kitchen, where we use traditional woks, steamers and mortar and pestles to make our food delicious. This class is completely hands-on, and you will get to see how we create a some classic local dishes in no time at all. Afterward, settle down in our very own backyard to tuck into a sumptuous feast! As I know everyone comes from different countries, I make it a point to explain what kinds of ingredients you can use in your own kitchen to replicate the unique taste and flavor of these Balinese dishes. Here is an example of some of the dishes we will be cooking: Kuah Wong - Clear Mushroom & Vegetable Soup Be Siap Mesanten - Chicken in Coconut Curry Sate Siap - Minced Chicken Grilled on Bamboo Sticks Kacang Me Santok - Vegetables in Peanut Sauce Jukut Urab - Coconut and Snake Bean Salad Pepesan Be Pasih - Steamed Fish in Banana leaves Tempe Me Goreng - Deep fried Tempe in Sweet Soy Sauce Kolak Biu - Boiled Banana in Palm Sugar Syrup You will receive a recipe book that you can take home after the class.
strTitle: Whip up a Feast in a Traditional Balinese Compound in Ubud

strIntroduction: Enjoy the beautiful, unique landscape of our camp as you venture out for a 30-minute trek with our majestic Sumatran elephants along the edge of the valley. We have 15 wonderful elephants at our camp, and you'll get to meet and spend time with one of them during this ride. Seated atop the head of this gentle giant, your own fun-loving mahout will explain more about the elephants and their individual personalities and you can ask him any questions you'd like about what we do at the camp! During this leisurely stroll, you may also get to see monkeys and tropical birds in their natural habitat. Look down at the raging Ayung River and discover how much fun riding an elephant can be! As we come to the end of the ride, your elephant will show you the pool as they wade through the water to cool off from the hot sun. Your friendly mahout also will help you snap photos with your lovely mount as a souvenir! After the ride, relax and enjoy a delicious set lunch at the ‘Trunk’n’Mahout’ café and enjoy the elephants walking by. For some dessert after your meal, our on-site Chocolate factory offers a quick look at the process of chocolate-making. You can even create your own elephant-shaped treats with our delicious range of toppings! PICK UP AND DROP OFF TIMES: From: Kuta / Legian / Seminyak / Sanur (times are approximate and depend on traffic) Pick up: 08.00 - 08.15; return 15.00-15.30 Pick up: 09.30 - 09.45; return 16.30 - 17.00 Pick up: 11.00 - 11.15; return 18.00 - 18.30 From Nusa Dua: Pick up: 08.00 - 08.15; return 15.30-16.00 Pick up: 09.30 - 09.45; return 17.00 - 17.30 Pick up: 11.00 - 11.15; return 18.30 - 19.00 From Ubud Pick up: 08.30 - 08.45; return 14.00 - 14.30 Pick up: 09.30 - 09.45; return 15.00 - 15.30 Pick up: 11.30 - 11.45; return 16.00 - 16.30
strTitle: 10% OFF Go Elephant Trekking at Bali Elephant Camp

strIntroduction: This romantic experience begins with a deeply relaxing full body couples massage, followed by a detoxifying Infrared Sauna session. Known as one of the best health regimes today, a 75 minute session is said to increase blood and nutrient supply, leaving the skin radiant and purified. In a state of total serenity, you will then soak in a Himalayan crystal salt Jacuzzi while you enjoy each other's company. After sunset, our Executive Chef will prepare one of his specialties, a Seductive Seafood Dinner for Two. Divulge in a rich selection of Mediterranean seafood, including fresh oysters, prawns, snapper ceviche and an unforgettable exotic chocolate fondue with sweet grapes and strawberries for desert. A bottle of sparkling wine rounds up the perfect evening with a breathtaking sunset as a backdrop. ******************** ALTERNATIVE MENU - NON SEAFOOD (all items below will be served) Wagyu beef carpaccio, chargrilled artichoke & truffle salad Confit chicken terrine, garlic bruschetta, peach chutney Chicken caesar salad ***** Grilled lamb cutlets, Greek salad Organic salad with avocado, feta cheese, pumpkin seeds, walnuts, bean sprouts & extra virgin olive oil Thai beef salad, cucumber & mint Sugar cane chicken skewers, sambal matah & tom yum vinaigrette ***** Valrhona chocolate cream, caramel sauce, peanut ice cream & chocolate jelly Summer fruit pudding, peppermint crème fraiche
strTitle: Romantic Candlelight Dinner and Spa Overlooking a Cliff

strIntroduction: On your special holiday to Bali, come let us share our secret traditional Balinese with a special culinary experience for two. Our Balinese chef will guide you to prepare for the cooking, with an early morning trip at 7am to buy the cooking ingredients at Ubud’s traditional market. It is also an opportunity to see the Balinese way of life as they purchase their wares (and bargain their way to a good price). The cooking starts at 11.00am in a traditional Balinese kitchen compound surrounded by our organic garden and rice fields. If you love to cook vegetarian good, you can pick any kind of spices or vegetables such as tomatoes, lettuce, potatoes, and even eggplants. The best part of our morning will be when you taste the fruits of your labor as you tuck into lunch on a wooden deck surrounded beautiful rice field views. There are 3 menus to choose from (please state which is your choice when making a booking): MENU A Seafood Soup Clear seafood soup with vegetables and ginger *** Green Curry Mixed vegetable curry with Balinese spices and coconut milk OR Chicken Curry Boiled chicken with vegetables in Balinese curry sauce and coconut milk *** Dadar Gulung Rolled Balinese crepe with grated coconut and palm sugar MENU B Wong Soup Clear spiced mushroom soup with kaffir lime leaf *** Sate Lilit Grilled minced seafood with Balinese sauce on skewers OR Be Sampi Base Genep Braised beef with Balinese sauce and coconut milk *** Kolak Pisang Boiled banana with palm sugar and coconut milk VEGETARIAN MENU: Wong Soup Clear spiced mushroom soup with kaffir lime leaf *** Green Curry Mixed vegetable curry with Balinese spice and coconut milk *** Dadar Gulung Rolled Balinese crepe with grated coconut and palm sugar
strTitle: Private Couple's Cooking Class overlooking the Rice Paddies

strIntroduction: While my classes are flexible and the start time can be tweaked upon request, if possible, I recommend starting our day at 9am with a market tour in the morning at the new Kuta market (Pasar Kuta Bahru, which is walking distance from my house), where you will get to see fresh produce and oogle at the offerings. I will explain the unique ingredients on sale. After the tour, we will return to my house where my class will cover 5 dishes of your choosing. Just so you are able to replicate the results when you get home, I will give you detailed recipes and photos of the spices we use. Some of my most popular dishes include: - Beef Rendang (beef cooked in coconut milk and chilli paste) - Chicken Sate with Peanut Sauce - Nasi Goreng (fried rice) - Chicken Bumbu Bali (Spicy Chicken soup) - Gado-gado with peanut sauce - Fish pepes (Fish and spice, wrapped in banana leaf, then steamed) - Chicken Betutu As I mention in my profile, I have taught lots of guests every year, including ambassadors and professional chefs, and they always love my dishes, so I look forward to seeing you in my kitchen soon! Please Note: If you are staying in outside of Kuta or Seminyak, please take your own transport (at your own expense) to the BIMC Hospital (all the taxi drivers know where this is) where I will meet you and lead your car to my house.
strTitle: Kuta Cooking Class: A Balinese Feast in Maria's Kitchen

strIntroduction: There are few female guides in Bali because females are traditionally more involved in the household and community. I can bring you to key sights in Bali such as Uluwatu, Tanah Lot, Ubud art villages, Goa Gajah temple to name a few. I can also explain about the history, culture, and traditions of Balinese lifestyle in each location. This tour is fully customizable and can be tweaked based on your preferences. Let me know what you would like to see and I will plan an itinerary for you. Here is an example of a suggested itinerary: A. Kintamani Authentic Experience: 1. Balinese Traditional House. Visiting a traditional house is beginning way to know the culture of Bali. 2. Batuan Village Temple. The temple architecture and carvings are very beautiful and distinctive. To visit the temple becomes a memorable experience during your vacation to Bali. 3. Mount and lake Batur. The view of mount and lake Batur is one of the favorite destinations in Bali and it become an icons of tourism attractions in Kintamani. 4. Bali herbs and coffee plantation. Instead of oranges, Kintamani is also renowned of Arabica and Robusta coffee. YOu can taste the coffee that will be served with a variety of flavors of traditional making process. The Chivet Coffee (Luwak Coffee) is also one of the favorite choices of the coffee products. 5. Gunung Kawi holy temple. The complex of Gunung Kawi temple is built to honor the Udayana King. In this area you will get a calm and peaceful atmosphere. It is located on the bank of the rivers. This temple is the ideal place to meditate, pray, and sightseeing. B. Tanah Lot tour 1. Tanjung benoa water sport. 2. Tanah Lot temple. The temple that is located on a large offshore rock. 3. Canggu beach. To enjoy the sunset and walk along the beach. C. Bedugul and Jatiluwih Tour 1. Taman Ayun (World UNESCO heritage). The Royal Temple of Mengwi Empire which is surrounded by the big fish pond and look like a drift on the water 2. Bedugul and Ulundanu temple. Enjoy the scenery in Ulundanu Temple and beratan lake 3. Jatiluwih Rice field (World UNESCO Heritage). The one of famous Traditional Irrigation System in Bali (Subak) D. Uluwatu tour: 1. Pandawa Beach 2. Uluwatu Temple : Set on a cliff bank with a stunning view of the Indian ocean 3. Jimbaran Bay: Enjoy a freshly-grilled seafood dinner at one of the best beaches in Bali. If you are looking for a female guide for your female group while in Bali, then join me on this tour!
strTitle: Explore Bali with a Female Guide

strIntroduction: If you're interested in exploring the true heart and soul of Bali, come and discover our beautiful village of Sidemen, a hidden paradise in the northeastern part of Bali. Take a walk through the beautifully scenic rice terraces (with Mount Agung in the distance) and cross stunning river streams while you take in the picture perfect countryside around you. When you return, enjoy a mouthwatering healthy lunch at Cepik Villa, our chic and welcoming Balinese-style property. A 60 minute Balinese massage in our spa pavilion completes your day with us, pampering you to perfection before we send you on your way (alternatively, you can opt for a private yoga and meditation lesson in the afternoon) This is the Bali you came to discover, so don't leave without coming to see our little piece of paradise! DETAILED ITINERARY - SPA OPTION 07: 00: Pick up from your hotel in Bali 08:30: Arrive at Cepik Villa in Sidemen, enjoy a warm welcome drink of rosella or ginger tea 09:00: Start your morning fresh with a scenic 3-hour-long rice paddy and village trekking experience with our local guide. He will lead you to cross some shallow rivers, and take you on a hidden path to discover the best views in the area. You will even visit a local tile factory on the way back and see how they still make them by hand. 12:00: Return to base camp at Cepik Villa and enjoy a refreshing freshly-picked young coconut 13:00: Tuck into a healthy, organic lunch overlooking the countryside 15:00 Enjoy a 60 minute exotic Balinese massage at our spa pavilion 16:15: Leave for your hotel 18:00: Arrive back at your hotel DETAILED ITINERARY - YOGA OPTION 07: 00: Pick up from your hotel in Bali 08:30: Arrive at Cepik Villa in Sidemen and enjoy a warm welcome drink of rosella or tea 09:00: Start your morning fresh with a scenic 3-hour-long rice paddy and village trekking experience with our local guide. He will lead you to cross some shallow rivers, and take you on a hidden path to discover the best views in the area. You will even visit a local tile factory on the way back and see how they still make them by hand. 12:00: Return to base camp at Cepik Villa and enjoy a freshly picked young coconut to refresh yourself 13:00: Tuck into a healthy, organic lunch overlooking the countryside 15:00: Balance your mind with a 1.5-hour-long meditation and yoga session 16:15: Leave for your hotel 18:00: Arrive back at your hotel Additional activities we can arrange: - A visit to a local weaver's house (no formal fee, just a small donation for the family) - Egg painting activity
strTitle: Relaxing Day Trip to Sidemen: Trekking, Lunch & Spa/Yoga

strIntroduction: First hike will be exploring the Campuhan Ridge. Campuhan is a sacred area and means ‘where two rivers meet’ - Sungai Wos and Sungai Agung. This river valley is a stunning area to walk around and do some exploring on the narrow paths. After an hour hiking in Campuhan Ridge, we will continue to explore the scenic Tegalalang Rice field, located a quick 20 minutes away from Campuhan Ridge.This scenic drive will take you through the countryside of Ubud. Tegalalang Rice Field is the most visited rice field in Bali. It is designed very beautifully with exquisite patterns located precisely on a hill bank. Witness the local farmers planting their rice in oblique areas complete with its traditional irrigation system called Subak. Enjoy the beauty and greenery of rice and its valley with coconut trees on it. Bali Pulina located just 5 minutes driving from Tegalalang Rice Field will be the next stop on the trip. Bali Pulina is a hiden organic plantation where we can learn how Balinese Coffee is made. It is the best place for sampling the different coffee, tea, pure cocoa, and organic spices with a very beautiful rice field and valley setting. Bali Pulina also has the most unique coffee in world called Luwak Coffee. If you haven't heard about it already, this is a rare type of coffee partially fermented by passing it through the digestive system of a civet cat. The cats eat only the best berries and the stones are collected after they pass through their digestive system. Legend has it that drinking Kopi Luwak is good for fertility. The hike will be completed by a trip to Gunung Kawi , the 11th-century temple complex nestled among rice paddies and thick jungle in Tampaksiring, north-east of Ubud. To get there, you need to conquer some 270 steps, but it’s a special place well worth the effort. The huge shrines are carved into the cliffs at both sides of Pakerisan River connected by a stone bridge. It is also known as a World Heritage site by UNESCO 2012 located along Pekerisan River. Itinerary: 07.00 - Hotel pick up at Kuta, Nusa Dua, Sanur Area. 08.00 - Hotel Pick up at Ubud Area. 09.00 - Ubud Eco Walk (1 hour rice field walk). 10.15 - Leaving Ubud Area for Tegalalang Rice Field. 10.45 - Exploring and hiking Tegalalang Rice Field for 1 hour 13.00 - Lunch at Alon Alon Restaurant overlooking Tegalalang Rice Field. 14.30 - Bali Pulina to explore organic spices plantation and taste the most unique coffee worldwide called Luwak Coffee overlooking scenic valley with rice field on it. 15.15 - Leaving for Gunung Kawi. 15.45 - Explore Gunung Kawi with its beautiful surroundings (Waterfall, River, Rice Field Ancient Temple). 17.00 - Heading back to your hotel through the beautiful Balinese countryside
strTitle: Go on an Eco Walk around Ubud

strIntroduction: Are you an incurable foodie who wants to explore the beauty of Balinese cuisine? Come on a food tour with me to hunt down and savour the amazing amalgam of Indonesian, Indian and Chinese flavours which make up this distinctive cuisine. Once you decide what dishes you'd like to taste, we can visit a range of restaurants, roadside warungs and night markets to get into the spirit of things! The list of typical Balinese dishes include: Babi guling: famous Balinese roasted suckling pig Betutu: seasoned steamed or roasted poultry (chicken or duck) - a specialty of Bali and Lombok Bubur Sum-Sum: rice porridge with palm sugar sauce and grated coconut. Bubur Injun (black rice pudding): black sticky rice with coconut milk. Bantal: packages of sticky rice, coconut, sugar and fruit (often bananas or sometimes orange rind or even mango essence Kopi Luwak (Luwak coffee): also called civet coffee or “poo coffee”. It is named after the practice of weasel-like animals called civets let loose into coffee plantations at night to eat coffee berries then poop out the coffee beans which are collected, washed and roasted over a fire Sate Lilit: spiced mince meat on a stick Sayur Urab:mixed salad Sate Susu (milk satay): a spicy spicy beef brisket satay prepared to be "milky" and served with hot chilli sauce. Popular in Bali and Java. Rendang: meat with coconut milk (Minangkabau: karambia) and a paste of mixed ground spices, which includes ginger, galangal, turmeric leaves, lemon grass, garlic, shallot, chili peppers and other spices. Nasi Campur: rice with various dishes Gado-Gado: a salad consisting of boiled vegetables served with a peanut sauce dressing.
strTitle: Eat your way through Bali

strIntroduction: Whether you're on your honeymoon or on a romantic vacation, indulge in a magical moment with your loved one with this luxurious dinner for two. Our five star resort is located at a unique spot in Bali's secluded southern coast, with dramatic cliffs and sheer drops giving way to priceless views of the Indian Ocean below. We have set aside 2 locations to create this special dinner for you (please indicate which you will prefer when you are booking this dinner) LOCATION 1. Our best view point, located in the top of our resort in a private corner facing the wide open Indian ocean. The perfect time to witness Bali's sunset is here at 6pm. LOCATION 2. On an island we construct on our cliff edge infinity pool, also facing the majestic Indian Ocean below. As the pool is closed at 8pm, we can only organise dinners starting from 8pm here. What makes this dinner special is our exceptionally romantic atmosphere at dusk. As the sun sets and you witness the dramatic sky before you, the lady will receive a single red rose and you can both admire the amorous rose petal decorations and candles surrounding your table.
