strIntroduction: Tailor-made for both non-certified and certified divers, Bali Scuba Diving activities from Bali Hai allow you to savor one of the best dive sites around Nusa Lembongan and Nusa Penida islands. The Nusa Lembongan and Nusa Penida region is home to a variety of great dive sites. The famous dive sites like Crystal Bay and Manta Point are home to some incredible marine life like Mola Mola's (Oceanic Sunfish) and huge oceanic Manta Rays. The reefs around neighbouring Nusa Penida are in beautiful condition and offer exhilarating drift dives along pristine coral walls. We are very lucky at Bali Hai Cruises to have our own international dive center – Bali Hai Diving Adventures. As a family oriented cruise Bali Hai diving offers you and your family the chance to try scuba diving for the very first time with our specialized PADI Discover Scuba Diving program. You get the chance to dive Nusa Lembongan bay with our team of PADI scuba diving professionals as they guide you through the basics; this is a great way to try scuba in a really safe yet beautiful environment. Nusa Penida and Nusa Lembongan are well known for their world class dive sites. If you are a certified diver then you may be able to join us for some exceptional dives. At certain times of year we have the Mola Mola around, which are incredible creatures. Bali is only one of a very few places worldwide where you can see them while scuba diving. Manta trips are available daily for certified divers. These graceful giants will be the highlight of your dive trip in Nusa Lembongan and Nusa Penida OPTIONS for Diving during Day Cruise activities: OPTION 1: Beach Club Cruise (more relaxing option) 8:35 Boarding. Morning tea and coffee, pastries served. 9:15 Our boat departs Benoa Harbour. 10:00 Snorkeling demonstration on the Sundeck. 10:30 Our boat arrives at the pontoon in Lembongan Bay, guests transfer to our Beach Club on smaller vessels. 10:40 All diving activities commence from Beach Club: you'll be assigned a time slot for that 12:30 BBQ lunch is available until 14:00. Complimentary tea / coffee and water is served throughout the day at our restaurant. 13:15 Treasure hunt for children – meet at the information counter. 14:30 Tug of war on the beach. 14:45 When you hear the Kul Kul (traditional bell) please check you have all personal belongings and prepare for return to pontoon and our boat from the beach. 15:15 Enjoy the live band on the aft bridge deck. 16:15 We arrive back at Benoa Harbour. OPTION 2: Reef Cruise Schedule (for maximum time to enjoy water sports) 8:45 Boarding. Morning tea and coffee, pastries served. 9:15 The boat departs Benoa Harbour. 10:00 Snorkeling demonstration on the Sundeck. 10:30 The boat arrives at the pontoon in Lembongan Bay, guests transfer to Beach Club on smaller vessels. You'll have diving Intro lesson at the pontoon and then will depart on smaller vessel to the dive spot. 11:30 Buffet lunch opens on the main deck, closes at 14:15. First Village Tour departs, returns at approx.12:30. 12:30 Second Village Tour departs, returns at approx. 13:30 13:30 Third Village Tour departs, returns at approx. 14:30 14:15 Buffet lunch closes, tea and coffee available until 15:15 15:00 Water activities finish. 15:10 Head count prior to departure. 15:15 We depart from the pontoon. Enjoy the live band on the aft bridge deck. 16:15 We arrive back at Benoa Harbour. PICK UP TIMES 07.15 - 07.30: Ubud / Tanah Lot 07.30 - 07.45: Seminyak/Legian/Bukit/Ulutwatu 07.45 - 08.00: Kuta / Tuban / Nusa Dua / Jimbaran 08.00 - 08.15: Sanur
strTitle: Bali Scuba Diving at the Best Dive Sites of Nusa Lembongan

strIntroduction: A day to create your own heirloom piece of silver jewelry. Skillfully guided from design through each step of the production process you will learn how to work silver into wearable art. Five (5) grams of silver is included in the price and is sufficient to create a pair of earrings, a ring or a pendant. This is a one of a kind creative experience. Silver jewelry making, like most old crafts in Bali, is a family affair. Gusti Ayu was taught to make silver jewelry by her father and her older brother. From the early age of 9 she was allowed to polish the silver pieces her family was creating for sale in America and Australia. In Bali, the jeweler’s practiced eye and steady hand is developed over time by children helping their families after school. When you watch Ayu handle the tools and manipulate the silver that will become your personalized silver jewelry you’ll appreciate the years of patient learning that silver jewelry-making entails. Take a half day for Ayu to introduce you to this special realm of art-making. Bring your jewelry ideas to Ayu and she will help you to craft your idea into a wearable piece of silver jewelry. In a few short hours one can sample the jeweler’s craft as both you and Ayu work together to work new silver into a polished art piece. It’s fun, it’s a challenge and a terrific way to spend your leisure time in Bali. We have two slots everyday, a morning slot and an afternoon slot: - Morning Class: 10am - Afternoon Class: 2pm
strTitle: Create your own Piece of Silver Jewelry

strIntroduction: This eco-tour includes: -Shark feeding -Shark swim (mask, snorkel, life jacket, towel provided) -A visit to the Turtle Conservation & Education Center (You can pet baby turtles and release them during some seasons of the year) Indonesia has an estimated 250 species of Sharks, over half of these species are still unknown. Indonesia is also the top shark catching country, with an estimate of 110,000tons caught and traded a year. Shark numbers in some areas have declined more than 90%. This conservation nursery offers an alternative to young sharks being killed. We buy the sharks off the fishermen while they're still alive on the way to the market for trading. The same fishermen that used to kill sharks for fins are now saving them! To date, over 70 sharks have been saved and/or released. All proceeds from this Eco-tour will be channeled towards efforts for saving the sharks. This includes buying them off fishermen and nursing them back to health before being released in the protected waters of Gili Island. Available everyday from 7am to 3pm.
strTitle: Swim with Sharks!

strIntroduction: Have you ever wanted to buy your own traditional Balinese outfit but are unsure of how to do so? On this exclusive experience, you will get your own personal shopper to help you choose the right outfit before visiting a temple like a local! If you're looking for something true to Balinese culture and tradition, this experience is for you. This experience is not just for the ladies, we welcome men and couples alike! MORE DETAILS: This tour begins with a pick up at your hotel lobby by one of our friendly staff members, who will then take you to a Balinese traditional market or special boutique, depending on what you prefer. Armed with your own personal shopper and stylist, you can be sure that we will find something to fit your size and style. After purchasing your very own outfit, we will take you to the studio to help you get dressed. For the ladies, the friendly and professional staff will also do your make up and hair to help you feel and look the part! Once you have completed your look, join us as we visit a temple and make an offering, just as us locals do. On the way to the temple, we will explain the meaning of each part of the ceremony and while at the temple, we will take photos for you, so you have a momento of your time with us! As part of this experience, you will receive 3 color photos in 5R size, and also receive a CD with all your photos for you to print at your convenience. ITINERARY: 09.30 am: Pick up at the hotel lobby to go shopping at the market or special boutique to selecting your own style, sarong and sash. 10.30 am: Transfer to the Salon for make-up and dressing (takes about 1 hour) 11.00 am: Go to the temple for the offering ceremony and photo shoot 12.30 pm: Lunch at Sawah Indah Restaurant in Ubud 1.30pm: Return to your hotel NOTE: We have 3 plans your can choose from. The difference between them lies primarily in the quality of the material you choose for your outfit: - Standard plan - Superior plan - Deluxe plan
strTitle: Shop for a Balinese Outfit and Visit a Temple like a Local

strIntroduction: See the wonders of the ocean up close and personal, with the underwater seawalker! Enjoy a safe and fascinating underwater walk on the ocean bed and witness the vibrant marine life swimming around you. In this experience, you will don a helmet with a transparent visor that will allow you to breathe normally while underwater. Weights will help to pull you down to the ocean bed, and an experienced guide will walk with you through this amazing underwater world. Free pick-up available from Kuta, Legian, Seminyak, Sanur, Jimbaran and Nusa Dua.
strTitle: Walk on the Ocean Bed with the Underwater Seawalker

strIntroduction: Whether you have an illness or you feel an imbalance in your life, a visit to a local healer can really help provide some insight into how you can regain confidance and joy again. When I personally had medical and family issues I was dealing with, I went to many healers before I found Tu Aji, who helped me overcome my troubles. I've been seeing him for years, and bring everyone who is serious about talking through their life's troubles with him. If you would like to find the 'real deal', I am happy to set up an appointment and bring you to see him. He's extremely gifted in sensing your troubles, and can give guidance on how to move forward. He doesn't speak English, but myself or my husband will bring you to provide translation. One-way transport from Ubud to his home in Tampaksiring (home of the holy spring water temple) will take 30minutes, and from Seminyak/Kuta, it will take about 1.5 hours.
strTitle: Visit a Local Healer & Get Your Life's Questions Answered

strIntroduction: Experience Bali from above with this awe-inspiring paragliding experience! Fly tandem with our expert instructors and glide gracefully through the air as you take in the incredible view of the Indian Ocean and cliffs below. For first timers, the initial adrenaline rush of the first lift off will give way to a sense of joy and serenity as you glide gently through the air with your newfound 'wings'. Whatever your experience level, you will be given all the necessary instructions for a smooth and safe flight. Your pilot is at your service and will steer and control wherever you wish to go during your 20 minute ride but if you're happy to enjoy the view, he'll take you on a flight you will never forget! Guided by your instructor, landing will also be a breeze. The best time to do this depends on the weather but we generally do this in the afternoons, with pick up at 1pm. The latest time we can lift off from our location is at approximately 4pm since winds pick up after that time. Our paragliding experience includes free round trip transport from Nusa Dua, Jimbaran, Kuta, Seminyak, Legian, Canggu, Sanur Flying season: April - November
strTitle: Go Paragliding along Bali's South Coast

strIntroduction: Always wanted to try your hand at one of these powerful vehicles? This is your chance. On this exhilarating tour, we will bring you to navigate through the rice-fields of Yeh Gangga (a seaside village just west of Tanah Lot) and meander through adjoining villages, with a stop on the top of the seaside cliffs overlooking the spectacular coastline and seaside temple. Experience the fun and exhilaration of cruising along the black sand beach, crossing fresh water streams, viewing the rural panorama and surf-side Yeh Gangga. Unlike other operators which might use lower-quality equipment, we provide high quality Honda and Yamaha Grizzly 700CC ATVs to ensure that your tour is safe, comfortable and fun. For your information, no license is needed to drive the ATVs. The children just need to be 12 years old to ride their own ATV but if they are below the age of 12, they are most welcome to ride tandem with their parents. INCLUDED: - Round trip transport from your hotel (for 2 hour experiences only): anywhere around Ubud and the South (Kuta, Nusa Dua, Jimbaran, Seminyak) - Minimum 2 pax for free pickup, otherwise need to pay the surcharge of $15 for individual Note: Transfers are NOT included for the 1-hour rides (please purchase the additional transport option below if you are booking 1-hour rides)
strTitle: Bali ATV Tours: Seaside Villages and Beach Ride

strIntroduction: For an unforgettable day out on the water in Bali, come sail with us across the Badung straight to Lembongan island on a luxurious 20-ton catamaran every Monday, Wednesday, Thursday and Saturday. This excursion includes all items below and gives you exclusive access to our beach club on Lembongan Island. INCLUDES: - Return land transfers from your hotel to Benoa harbor (Nusa Dua, Sanur, Jimbaran, Kuta, Legian, Seminyak, Uluwatu, Pecatu) - Free flow drinks on the catamaran (orange juice, soft drinks, mineral water, tea and coffee) -Pastries and seasonal fruits - BBQ lunch buffet at a private beach club on Nusa Lembongan with a glass of wine or beer during lunch, soft drinks, mineral water, tea & coffee - Use of the beach club's swimming pool and other facilities - table tennis, volley ball yard, chess, bicycle, boogie board, canoe, backgammon, shower/restroom, - Snorkeling or reef viewing from the glass bottom boat or a village tour of seaweed farms and the famous underground house - A complimentary cocktail with sliced cheese and crackers as we sail back into the sunset - A crew of 5 - Insurance Coverage: US$ 100,000 per person Itinerary: 08:30 : boarding time 09:00 : depart from Benoa Harbor 10:45 : arrive at Lembongan Island 11:00 : activities (Snorkeling or Village tour) 13:00 : Buffet lunch 15:00 : activities (Snorkeling or Village tour) 15:15 : depart from Lembongan Island 17:00 : Arrive at Benoa Harbor Pick up time: Kuta, Legian, Seminyak, Jimbaran at 07:30 - 07:45 Nusa Dua, Sanur at 08:00 Pecatu, Uluwatu at 07:00 - 07 - 15 NOTE: We need a minimum of 15 persons to sail on Mondays, Wednesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays, so if we are unable to meet those numbers, we will contact you at least 2 days prior and offer you the following options: - Move to another boat sailing to Lembongan, but still enjoy our 5-star service, i.e. village tour, snorkeling, beach club, etc. - Cancel the booking for a full refund - Move to another day if available with some special gift from WakaSailing.
strTitle: Sail to Scenic Nusa Lembongan on a Luxury Catamaran

strIntroduction: On this night tour in Bali jungle, we will search for wild snakes such as cobras, vipers, pythons, rat snakes, and various other colubrids. You may also sight lizards and turtles during this tour. We will start early evening and finish at about 1am. We will pick you up from your hotel and drop you back there afterward. We will start the tour at our depot, where you will be able to see whatever reptiles we have rescued for the week, plus any reptiles currently residing with us that require hospitalisation or treatment. Next, we will head out to find night creatures having fun in their natural environment. Long pants and closed shoes are needed. We provide lamps and other equipment as required. Pick up time from Kuta: 7.30pm Pick up time from Ubud: 8.30pm
strTitle: See Wild Snakes in the Jungles at Night

strIntroduction: Expert guides will explain the history of the land, culture, its people and take you on an unforgettable experience that will remain with you long after you leave. Stop to sample a variety of exotic fruits and spices then continue through the towering bamboo forest of Taro before ending with lunch at Bali's BIGGEST attraction, the Elephant Safari Park NOTE: Rest assured we will adjust the route according to your fitness level and will help you at any point along the way. When your children come with us, our guides will help them with the equipment and make sure they feel totally comfortable! PICKUP Nusa Dua 07.00-07.30 am Kuta/Seminyak 07.30-08.00 am Sanur 07.30-08.00 am Ubud 08.30-09.00 am ITINERARY 09.00 Arriving at the Ubud Adventure & Function Centre, Registration Process 09.15 Shuttle to Start Point of Cycling 09.45 Checking Bicycle & Start Cycling 11.45 Finish Cycling & Arriving at the Elephant Safari Park 12.00 Elephant Talent Show 12.15 Buffet Lunch at Park Restaurant 13.15 Feeding the Elephants and Baby Elephants 13.45 Visiting Museum and Elephant Discovery Information Centre 14.00 Depart from Elephant Safari Park & Lodge
strTitle: 20% OFF Bali Eco Cycling Tour in Ubud

strIntroduction: Explore the seas of Bali on an underwater scooter, a unique and exciting way to see marine life up close! This full day tour on Bali's beautiful sister island Nusa Ceningan includes: - access to our private beach area on Nusa Lembongan - a 15 minute underwater scooter ride - a fantastic snorkeling session in the island's clear waters, with a glimpse at our beautiful underwater statues and lots of colourful tropical fish - a semi-dive - which allows you to breathe through our oxygen mask while submersing yourself in our 2-3 square metre underwater 'room' (it is equipped with steel bars to so you can interact freely with the fish) - unlimited banana boat rides - canoes for you to take out at your own leisure - a cock fighting demonstration The underwater scooter has a basic operating depth of approximately 3-5metres, and allows riders to glide through coral reefs and alongside colorful fishes with ease in a self-contained breathing environment. You will be accompanied by an experienced dive master guide throughout the journey to guide you to see the lovely fish and make sure that you are able to navigate the waters with ease. ITINERARY: 7-8am - Pickup from your hotel depending on location (see below) 8.45am - Depart from Serangan to Ceningan Island on a fast boat 9.30am - Arrive at Ceningan Island 10am - Underwater Scooter ride 10.45am - Semi-dive and snorkeling 12pm - Buffet lunch in our lunch area 1pm - Free and easy time on Ceningan Island. You may ride the banana boat as many times as you'd like, take a paddle on the canoe, play volleyball on the beach, or simply relax and enjoy the sunshine on one of the beach chairs by the sea. 2.45pm - Cock fight demonstration 3pm - Depart from Ceningan Island back to Serangan on a fast boat 4.30 - 5.30pm - Drop-off to your hotel Optional Activities: Jet Ski (US$50/person/round) Scuba Dive (US$85 / person) NOTE: This package includes free return transport from Nusa Dua, Jimbaran, Kuta, Seminyak, Legian, Denpasar and Sanur. For those staying in Ubud, please include the "Add on: Transport from Ubud" option in your booking. MENU: We provide lunch in a buffet BBQ chicken and seafood. We do not prepare a menu of beef or pork. Our menu consists of: vegetable soup, white rice / fried rice, green vegetables, chicken capcay, chicken satay, grilled chicken, grilled fish, fried squid, chilli sauce and fresh fruits. If you prefer a vegetarian menu, we would be happy to prepare it. MORE INFO ABOUT THE SEMI-DIVE: In a semi-dive, diving guests do not use gas tank in their back, but fresh air will be supplied from the gas tube above the pontoon / decks. Our semi-dive activity will be done in a special underwater steel cage. PICK-UP TIMES Nusa Dua: 07.15 – 07.30 Jimbaran, Kuta, Legian, Seminyak: 07.30 – 07.45 Sanur: 07.30 – 08.00
strTitle: Underwater Scooter, Diving, Banana Boat & Snorkeling

strIntroduction: Get picked up in Bali’s coolest mode of transport – the VW Safari Type 181. Cruise through the rice paddies and sleepy villages of Bali with the roof down and the wind rushing through your hair! To make the day unforgettable, we will stop the Saba Bay Stables for an hour-long horse ride along the volcanic sands. After that, it’s off to the lush Ayung valley for an unforgettable white water rafting adventure down 9km of incredible rapids set in tropical jungle scenery. After lunch, we will take you to Carangsari area where you wind through the most beautiful views on earth in this awesome vehicle!
strTitle: Full Day of Fun: Volkswagen Safari, Horseriding, Rafting

strIntroduction: In Hinduism, mankind is responsible for maintaining the ‘energy balance’ of the universe. This responsibility is fulfilled every day with the ritualized offerings prepared for all the various aspects which God manifests. When Hindus offer their offerings and prayers, God’s universe is re-energized and continues it’s existence unaltered. To not fulfill this responsibility is to bring disaster down upon ourselves and our world. Over hundreds of years, the Balinese women who create the daily offerings have crafted numerous, elegant arrangements from the natural bounty of Bali’s forests and farms. Spend two hours with us while we introduce you to the craft and the cultural-bounty that is Balinese ‘canang’- daily offerings. We have two slots everyday, a morning slot and an afternoon slot: - Morning Class: 10am - Afternoon Class: 2pm
strTitle: Prepare sacred Balinese Hindu offerings

strIntroduction: Come with us on this exhilarating morning tour to catch a glimpse of Bali's wild dolphins. Our powerful, high speed Ocean Raft departs daily at 7.30am and will take you on a thrilling journey to South Bali across the waves. Many guests think they have to make the long trek to Lovina in north Bali to see the dolphins, but this is a much shorter drive away from most hotels in the south. Upon arrival in the Dolphin watching area, our guides will take you to the best places possible to see these wonderful marine creatures. As ambassadors for the ocean environment, our Dolphin Watching Cruise does not allow you to touch the dolphins; we are only interested in positive interactions that will not harm the Dolphins. NOTE: This trip departs only on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays. PICK UP TIMES 06.15 - 06.30: Ubud / Uluwatu / Tanah Lot 06.30 - 06.45: Seminyak / Legian / Kuta / Tuban / Nusa Dua / Jimbaran / Canggu 06.45 - 07.00: Sanur ITINERARY: 07.00 - Arrival at Benoa harbour. Fruit juices and pastries will be served prior to boarding. 07:30 - Ocean Rafting vessel departs from Benoa harbour. Safety demonstration onboard. Cruising the South coast of Bali. Upon arrival in the Dolphin watching area, our guides will take you to the best places possible to see Dolphins. 09:00 - Start the return trip to Benoa. 09:30 - Ocean Rafting vessel arrives to Benoa harbour. Transfer back to hotel / accommodation. Did you know? All Dolphins have signature whistles that are equivalent to human names. Dolphins use these signature whistles to recognize other Dolphins and they also use signature whistles to call their fellows by ‘name’. It was discovered in recent research that Dolphins are capable to recognize signature whistles of other Dolphins even after being separated more than 20 years. This is proof of the longest social memories ever recorded in a non-human species.
strTitle: Dolphin Spotting Cruise in South Bali by Bali Hai Cruises

strIntroduction: Fruit carving is a delightful way to make food into art, or to make fun art that tastes good. It’s all about letting go of your inhibitions and using fruit as your medium for artistic expression. Children and adults can enjoy two hours of discovery while our teacher guides the student(s) through the process of crafting foods like melons and carrots into flowers and insects. This class gives new meaning to the phrase “making dessert”. Do you remember the silly fun you had when a young person compelled you to help them building their sand castle at the edge of the ocean surf? Fruit carving can evoke the same innocent fun and sense of discovery. Taking a simple piece of ‘food’ and crafting an animal form, or creating a spreading flower creation, can be a delightful way to spend an afternoon in Ubud. Our guests are always surprised at the many techniques our guru employs to craft a special shape from a simple fruit or vegetable. And this is a craft one can employ in the future to make your important holiday meals just a little bit more unique. Persons of all ages can enjoy the fruit carving class offered at W.S. Art Studio. Set aside a few hours with a special someone to laugh and marvel as you craft a carrot ‘butterfly’ and a ‘lotus’ melon at our gallery. Leave your normal day behind and settle in to explore this nuanced craft with our Balinese expert. We have two slots everyday, a morning slot and an afternoon slot: - Morning Class: 10am - Afternoon Class: 2pm
strTitle: Learn to Carve Fruits

strIntroduction: This is the only place in Bali where you can test a rickshaw and use it to enter the real Bali! In one day, you will feel the true spirit of the Island of the Gods, see the most famous and beautiful region of Bali, discover the way of life of the real Balinese people, “touch” nature, and bring home a wonderful souvenir of this island. This full day program will give you the opportunity to enjoy a whole host of activities. Upon your arrival, you will meet your guide near a Balinese temple. We will visit the temple and make your first contact with local traditions. You then start hiking a promenade in the famous Jatiluwih area, but on totally unknown and private farmer roads. We will stay and enjoy the rice terraces for approximately 1.5 hrs. No hard hiking here - just a moment of pleasure to walk through one of the most beautiful places of the world. During this walk, your guide will speak with you and share the secrets of the island with you. We eventually arrive at the Jatiluwih panorama which boasts a spectacular “mirror effect”. This is the biggest ricefield terrace panorama in Bali, but nobody except you can see it like this having come from the "inside". We then enjoy a real “Bali tea” served by the locals before you take pictures and join your rickshaw, named "becak" locally. You can drive yourself or be driven by a local Balinese member of the staff, it’s up to you! For more than 1 hour, you go downhill and sail across small villages, with children saying hello to you along the way. We stop in a rustic Balinese hosue and meet a lovely grandmother who will give you a private and exclusive “Bali offering lesson”. She will explain the purpose of the daily offerings to you and teach you how to make one. You will do one by yourself and take it with you! Another 15 minute ride on the rickshaw and we arrive at our restaurant for lunch. There, you will deposit your own offering basket to the local temple and enjoy a delicious Balinese lunch overlooking the spectacular rice terraces. After this lunch, you will have 45 minutes to appreciate the life of local farmers. You will join one of them in the field and try all parts of his daily work : ploughing with a buffalo, planting rice, walking with a hanging basket on the shoulder. This makes for great pictures! On the way back to your hotel, you stop at the lovely Bali Butterfly Park for a short visit. All Balinese come here to contribute the butterflies, cocoons and caterpillars they find, so you will see an amazing variety of butterflies. Some will even be bigger than your hand! It's been a lovely day in Bali, and one that you won't soon forget! PRICE INCLUDES: Bali tea Water during the promenade An offering lesson Balinese lunch (excluding drinks) All the tours and visits Return transport for minimum 2 persons from anywhere in the South or Ubud ADVENTURE PICK UP TIME: NUSA DUA 07.00 SANUR 07.00 UBUD 07.30 KUTA 07.30
strTitle: Ride a Rickshaw through Rice Terraces & Become a Farmer

strIntroduction: Hang on tight and experience flying in the air on this flying fish water sport ride! You will begin by lying down on the flying fish craft, then a speedboat will pull you out to sea. The speed of the wind will cause your flying fish craft to fly in the air! Free pick-up available from Kuta, Seminyak, Jimbaran, Legian, Nusa Dua, Sanur. (min 2person Booking)
strTitle: Ride an Exhilarating Flying Fish in Bali!

strIntroduction: Design and create your very own Mala necklace in this introductory three hour beaded jewelry making class. Malas are necklaces that are both beautiful and functional. Traditionally they are made with 108 beads plus an additional head bead or 'sumeru' , and have been used to help focus the mind in meditation and to count mantras while meditating to induce calm and peace. Traditionally they have been used widely in Buddhist and Hindu spiritual practices, and have been adopted by many people embracing spirituality and yogic traditions. Malas are made with a variety of different materials, and we will help you select beads that appeal to you. We have a variety of natural stones, wood, handmade glass, and rudraksha beads that you can choose from. You can choose from a variety of bronze or silver head beads which you can customize with letter and shape stamps. Making malas together is a great bonding experience for couples, friends, and parents and children, but is also great on your own to make something meaningful and original for yourself or a loved one. AVAILABLE: Monday-Friday (excluding national and religious holidays) Morning session: 09.00 - 12.00 Afternoon session: 13.00 - 16.00
strTitle: Make your own Prayer Bead Necklace or 'Mala'

strIntroduction: Enjoy a relaxing picnic lunch for two people served on a boat as it drifts around the lagoon in our tropical garden setting. This picnic pastime is the perfect opportunity to spend quality time with a loved one. Savour a basket full of light bites and take lots of romantic selfies during this delightful rendezvous on the water. ITINERARY 11.40 - Pick up from the Ubud center area 12:00 - Arrive to the resort and take a leisurely stroll to the venue 12:15 - Enjoy a picnic lunch on the boat Note: Pick up from Ubud center area is included in the price of the meal. Transport from all locations can be arranged at an additional cost - see price options for more details. MENU OPTION (If you have dietary requirements please let us know so we can adjust the meal accordingly and please select one of menu below upon booking. Halal menu is available on request.) Inclusive of 4 selected beverage (Choice of local beer, can of soft drink, mineral water or juices) Option 1 Garlic Bread Caesar Salad with Dressing Mix Satay (Chicken, Pork and Prawn) with Peanut Sauce Beef Burger Baked Potato or Rice Assorted Tropical Fresh Fruit Coffee and tea Option 2 Garlic Bread Green Salad with Balsamic Dressing Mix Satay (Chicken, Pork and Prawn) with Peanut Sauce Club Sandwich Baked Potato or Rice Assorted Tropical Fresh Fruit Coffee and tea
strTitle: Romantic Lunch in Bali: Picnic On A Boat In Ubud

strIntroduction: If you've always wanted to get behind the wheel of a supercar, take a ride down Bali's scenic highway in one of these beauties: - Porsche Boxster Spider - Ferrari F430 Spyder You get to drive a lap around the Mandara Toll-road in the supercar of your choice, while admiring the spectacular view of the sun and sea. Pick up from South Bali is included in this package, and our driver will bring you to meet at our start point - the Sanur side entrance of the Mandara Toll-road. Upon arrival, our instructor will show you the car and provide the necessary information on how to drive it. Following this, you will sit in the passenger seat with him driving and explaining how to use the gearshift etc. He will take you one lap on the scenic Mandara Toll-road while you familiarize yourself with the controls. After this instructional lap is done, you will be put in the driver's seat to drive the supercar of your choice back in the opposite direction. The whole experience will be photographed from inside and outside of the car and you will be provided with the footage at the end of the experience! Terms & Conditions: - minimum age: 20 years old - A copy of a valid driver's license will be require in advance - Extensive driving experience required - Any client showing up under the influence of alcohol, drugs or any hallucinogens will be banned from driving and the full price will be charged. - Any damaged done to the cars caused by action of the client will be charged directly to him or her.
strTitle: Drive a Supercar down the Highway in Bali

strIntroduction: This unique experience with a master wood carver is suitable for all ages and abilities. Working side by side, using the traditional simple tools, you will experience the insight that creates the fantastic wood carvings found in Bali. Your teacher will assist you to create an original carved egg, carved mask or animal. Bring the kids and spend a half day learning the ancient craft of wood carving. Our wonderful instructors can skillfully guide a novice wood carver to find the mask, the animal or the shape that is ‘hiding” inside each block of wood. Bali’s wood carvers are known throughout the world for their intricate and nuanced wood creations that adorn nearly every abode on the island. It’s a craft inherited from one family generation to the next. Don’t miss the opportunity to sample this extraordinary craft while on the island. We want everyone to enjoy the wood carving experience and to have a chance to stretch their creative muscle while vacationing in paradise. We have two slots everyday, a morning slot and an afternoon slot: - Morning Class: 10am - Afternoon Class: 2pm
strTitle: Carve your own Balinese Wood Mask

strIntroduction: Explore the historical, natural side of Bali by bicycle and discover the traditional ways of life quiet rural villages. The tour begins in the gorgeous river-valley of Sayan, Ubud. It is a 4 hour ride, 39 km, on back roads. Our experienced, professional guides know how to create trips that showcase a side of Bali that is very rarely experienced by tourists. The awe-inspiring sights, fun and adventure will be long-remembered after you leave Bali. Not only that, this cycling challenge includes treats breakfast and a delicious home cooked lunch in the beautiful garden at our private compound so you can experience the local side of life ============================================== PICK UP TIMINGS : Nusa Dua, Jimbaran area: 6.30 am - return 4.00 pm Kuta , Seminyak, Canggu area: 7.00 am - return 3.30 pm Ubud area: 7.30 am - return 3.00 pm ============================================== NOTE : This tour is for experienced cyclists in small groups.
strTitle: Go on a Bali Cycling Challenge (Advanced Riders Only)

strIntroduction: During our different ‘Surf Lessons’ (see levels below), you will lean how to surf and improve your skills in a relaxed, fun and safe environment. Our guides will respond and adapt to your likes and dislikes to ensure you make the best progress! To provide a little variety, we also offer Surf Day Trips. Depending on the weather and wave conditions we can take our surf students to different non-crowded Surf Spots around Bali (east & west coast). When the swell is not ideal, this is the perfect opportunity to explore the island! Check out our options below and pick out the one you like on the Price Options drop down box on the right! Surf lesson beginner: The beginner class is for non-experienced or beginners who want to refresh the basics. What you will learn: master to handle the board, the correct paddle-technique, take-off and first forehand and backhand turns. You will also learn about the ocean conditions and safety. Surf lesson intermediate: If you are able to stand up and you have caught and ridden green waves, you are ready for intermediate guiding. We will help you to improve your surfing skills and share surf secrets with you. Surf lesson advanced: We will guide you ‘outside’ and show you the right position to observe the sets of waves as they approach. You will learn how to duckdive, to chose the good waves and to do maneuvers like cutbacks, bottom and top turns. Surf lesson for kids kids: Let your kids make their first surf steps with a ‘Softboard’ and easily ride their first waves. Our guides will make sure to keep them safe the whole time! Private guiding: Private surf guiding is specifically adjusted to your skills. Use the opportunity of a private surf instructor to concentrate on certain areas to get your surfing to a higher level. Surf Day Trip: Besides surf lessons, we also offer you the opportunity of going out from the typical spots and surf different waves around Bali with our surf trips. (However, the destination will mainly depend on your surf level, wave and weather conditions) All instructors of our school are qualified with ‚Bronze Medallion and Life Saving Certificates’ (International Life Guard Association). We are also accredited by the Association Surf Instructor’ (ASI) and trained with First Aid and CPR Life Saving. Fees include: Pick up and drop off from your hotel in Seminyak, Kuta, Legian and Canggu Surfboards & rash guards
strTitle: Bali Surf Classes - Learn to Ride the Waves with Experts

strIntroduction: Discover how chocolate is made at our Chocolate Factory on the grounds of Bali Elephant Camp. The tour starts with an amazing ‘chocolate shot’ welcome drink, after which you’ll be taken through each step of the chocolate making process, from the cocoa tree to raw cacao, fermenting and roasting of the beans, and the final transformation into delicious dark, milk and white chocolate. During our journey, you’ll taste raw cacao, cocoa nibs and our handmade Bali chocolate before making your own chocolate elephants and decorating them with your favorite toppings to take home. This is the ultimate chocolate experience for anyone and everyone. We also have a great café where you can enjoy a tasty lunch and cool off with our amazing homemade ice cream. Our chocolate cafe supports local communities, which farm sustainably using organic practices, and turn cacao, nature's super food, into a range of delicious chocolates, pralines, cakes and ice-cream. For all you chocoholics, it’s chocolate heaven! Tours start every hour from 10am-3pm daily. == Itineraries == Morning Trip 08:30am - 09:30am Depart from your hotel (Depending on location, see below for pickup times) 10:00am Arrival & registration at Pod chocolate 10:00am - 10:15am Welcome drink and briefing 10:15am - 11:15am Explanation of how cacao grows, how it's processed into cocoa beans, and processed into fine chocolate, all of which you'll get to taste 11:15am - 12:00pm Chocolate Making 12:00pm - 12:30pm Finish chocolate making and wait for chocolate to cool (about 15 - 20 minutes) 12:30pm Depart for your hotel or opt for one of our optional extras such as lunch at Pod café or our Elephant restaurant Afternoon Trip 11:30am - 12:30pm Depart from your hotel (Depending on location, see below for pickup times) 01:00pm Arrival & registration at Pod chocolate 01:00pm - 01:15pm Welcome drink and briefing 01:15pm - 02:15pm Explanation of how cacao grows, how it's processed into cocoa beans, and processed into fine chocolate, all of which you'll get to taste 02:15pm - 03:00pm Chocolate Making 03:00pm - 03:30pm Finish chocolate making and wait for chocolate to cool (about 15 - 20 minutes) 03:30pm Depart for your hotel or opt for one of our optional extras such as a late lunch or snack at Pod café or our Elephant restaurant
strTitle: Tour the Pod Chocolate Factory and Learn to Make Chocolate

strIntroduction: Come and create your own tailor-made perfume, in your own personal laboratory space. We will assist you in concocting your own special perfume, using all of the finest essences from across the Indonesian archipelago. You will receive your very own individual 30ml bottle of perfume protected inside luxurious packaging to take away with you. Please keep in mind that this is an interactive workshop with qualified instructors so to ensure that they are able to assist you as much as possible there is a maximum of six guests per workshop. Book early to avoid disappointment! If you want an in-depth experience, feel free to book our 3-hour workshop, which includes a theory lesson on the art of making perfume from our highly skilled instructors. A diploma will be awarded to you at the end as proof of your talent and experience. The workshop is located in Nusa Dua at the Ritz-Carlton, Bali
strTitle: Create your own Luxury Perfume in Nusa Dua or Jimbaran

strIntroduction: If you're looking for a great day of adventure, combine our short elephant trek with any one of the following 6 programs: White Water Rafting Jatiluwih Rice Paddy Cycling Kintamani Mountain Cycling Village Cycling, Bedugul Jungle Trekking Horse Riding See 2 options below (let us know which activity you would like to add to your elephant trek so we can make arrangements accordinly) OPTION 1: Elephant Ride + Jatiluwih Rice Paddy Cycling / Kintamani Mountain cycling / Village cycling /Bedugul Jungle Trekking /Horse Riding: 08.00 - 08.15: Depart from hotel 09.15 – 10.00: Arrive at starting point, welcome drink, and registration, safety talk 10.30 – 10.45: Start one choice of activities : Cycling, Jungle trekking or Horse riding 13.00 – 14:00: Finish activity and have Lunch 14.00 – 14.15: Finish lunch, transferred to Bali Elephant Camp 14.30 – 15.00: Arrive at Bali Elephant Camp. Welcome drink & registration 15.00 – 15.15: Start Elephant ride ( 30 minutes ) 15.30 – 15.45: Finish riding, taking pictures, feed the elephants (a basket of fruit is an additional charge of US$ 3 ) 16.00 – 16.15: Transfer back to hotel 17.15 – 17.30: Arrive at Hotel OPTION 2: Elephant Ride + Rafting experience 08.00 - 08.15: Depart from hotel 09.15 - 09.30: Arrive at Bali elephant camp 09.45 - 10.00: Start elephant ride (30 minutes) 10.15 - 10.30: Finish riding, taking pictures, feed the elephants (a basket of fruit is an additional charge of US$ 3 ) 10.45 - 11.00: Transferred to rafting start point (which is just next door) 11.15 - 11.30: Safety briefing, put on equipment 11.30 - 13.30: Rafting experience 13.30 - 13.45: Shower 13.45 - 14.30: Lunch 14.30 - 14.45: Transfer back to the hotel NOTE: - The above itineraries are only for pick up at Kuta, Legian, Seminyak and Sanur area. - For Nusa Dua, Jimbaran and Tanjung Benoa, it will take 1.5 – 2 hours to get to our location. - For Ubud, the journey will take 30 – 45 minutes to our location. MORE ABOUT EACH EXPERIENCE: ELEPHANT TREK: Befriend a great Sumatran elephant on our Adventurer Trek! Safely perched on the broad back of this majestic giant, you will plunge into a verdant tropical landscape, catching glimpses of chattering monkeys and colorful birds, as the trail follows the the banks of the raging Ayung River. At the end of the ride, your intelligent mount will cool off in the wading pool (while carefully keeping you high and dry) before delivering you to the Trunk'n'Mahout' cafe for refreshments overlooking the stunning valley scenery. WHITE WATER RAFTING Experience the Bali's singular approach to white-water rafting with a morning or afternoon excursion down the sacred Ayung River winding through the heartland of the island. During two hours of tranquil drifting punctuated by thrilling moments of shooting the rapids, you will Discover hidden waterfalls, swim in the pristine water, and gain insight into river ecology and Balinese daily life from our expert and knowledgeable guides. The experience ends at Karang Dalem with a hot shower and buffet lunch overlooking the stunning panorama of the river you have just explored. JATILUWIH RICE PADDIES CYCLING Cruise through the sleepy villages of Bali, the World Heritage Site of Jatiluwih where you can enjoy mostly an up-hill cycling tour for about 3 hours through the most beautiful terraced rice paddies in the world before enjoying a sumptuous lunch overlooking the stunning scenery. KINTAMANI MOUNTAIN CYCLING Enjoy a light breakfast overlooking Lake Batur and the still active Volcano Gunung Batur. The Start Point is located a further 15 minutes away, and it is there you will be outfitted with helmets, cycling gloves, and mountain bike and given a full safety and instructional brief by our expert guides. Mostly down-hill 3 hours course will take you through local villages, farms and rice paddy terraces. The off-road adventure includes a visit to a local Balinese housing compound and family temple. Finish in the artisans’ colony of Ubud. BALI VILLAGE CYCLING Takes you through the back roads of the famous Carang Sari Village where you can glimpse the real life and culture of these amazing people. Cruise through untouched rice paddies, pass the Bali Elephant Camp for a quick stop just to get a picture of the biggest animal .Enjoy the local scenery and visit the Sangeh Monkey Forest to meet its cheeky inhabitants. Lunch is served overlooking panoramic of Ubud. BEDUGUL JUNGLE TREKKING Enjoy 3 hours trekking taken 5km into farming area and discover the tropical mountain rain forest, near the lake village of Bedugul, where flora and fauna thrive, with mixed up and down the hill. Experience cross the calm lake water in a traditional dugout canoe. This exotic trek into the heart of Balinese nature offers spectacular undisturbed natural beauty and photographic opportunities. And as a part of our conservation activity, you will have a chance to plan the trees in Bedugul area. Horse Riding Explore hidden places accessible only on foot and experience the thrill of a gallop along the beach with our horse-back excursion along Saba Beach. After a comprehensive safety briefing from our professional guides, you will embark on a memorable horse-riding experience over black volcanic sands alongside the crashing waves of this pristine, seldom-visited beach, with the stark hills of Nusa Penida island and the great volcanic cone of Gunung Agung as a backdrop. You will see the brightly colored jukung boats of the village fishermen, and visit the Segara Wilis temple, where they made offerings to protect them from the perils of the sea. During the ride you will leave the beach to explore villages’ gardens of banana, pineapple, bamboo, and the alang-alang that forms the roof of every traditional Balinese dwelling.
strTitle: Elephant Trek + Rafting / Cycling / Trekking / Horse Riding

strIntroduction: First, we will arrive at Uluwatu Temple to enjoy a spectacular sunset with a panoramic view of the Indian Ocean, complimented by a spiritual Balinese Hindu temple on the edge of the peninsula. For some additional insight into Balinese Culture, catch the mystic Kecak Dance performed on the cliffside, adjacent to the temple. Your final destination will be a seafood cafe serving delicious BBQ in Jimbaran Bay. You can enjoy this with your feet in the sand as its right on the beach. What a perfect end to the evening! ITINERARY: 15:15 Pick up at your Hotel Lobby 17:00 Visit and explore Uluwatu Temple 18:00 Watch Kecak Dance performance and enjoy Sunset at Uluwatu Temple *Sunset can not be guaranteed. This is highly dependant on the weather condition. 19:30 Enjoy BBQ Seafood Dinner at Jimbaran Bay 20:30 Return to hotel 21:00 Arrive back at your hotel NOTES: 1. The Kecak dance performance at Uluwatu Temple starts at 18:00 every day. In case of bad weather condition, it will be performed at the smaller stage. The price of the ticket is included in this tour. 2. Hotel Pick Up Area: Nusa Dua, Tanjung Benoa, Kuta, Legian, Jimbaran, Seminyak, Kerobokan, Canggu, Sanur, Denpasar, Ubud *Additional charge from Ubud and other suburbs 3. Sudden schedule changes may occur due to Balinese religious events which block the road etc. We ask for your patience and understanding in this matter. 4. Dinner menu: pre-determined set of dishes including BBQ fish, prawns, clams and squid, served with steamed rice, balinese spinach, condiments, mixed fruits and mineral water. The items in this package meal may change without prior notice due to the restaurant's stocks, so thank you in advance for your understanding. 5. If you do not eat seafood, the restaurant is able to switch the seafood menu with below menu. Please just note this preference when you are making the booking. NON-SEAFOOD MENU - Chicken fried rice - Mixed fried vegetables (cap cay) - Fried or grilled chicken - Fruit - Mineral water
strTitle: Kecak Dance & Seafood Dinner : Uluwatu Sunset Tour

strIntroduction: This is a fascinating introduction to Balinese Batik techniques, tools and dyes. A fun-filled, creative workshop to produce an original design, or to try to master the detail of a traditional one. Working in vibrant colors with a skilled teacher, this class is guaranteed to be one of your most unforgettable memories of Bali. Attention is now being brought to the truly dynamic evolution of fabric art that has evolved over a millennia among the thousands of islands and the hundreds of cultures that comprise present-day Indonesia. Different fabric designs, motifs and colors identify finished fabrics with their source islands and villages. Fabric making is a labor intense craft that often requires the efforts of dozens of persons, over many weeks of long days spent boiling colors from plants and trees, drying and dyeing the hand-spun cotton and then slowly weaving repeating motifs on hand-made looms. Right now these fabrics are being marketed as fine art to the Western world, and justifiably so. Batik is the “wearable art” for the average Indonesian. Taking a colorless cotton fabric, inventive folk have traced in wax vibrant designs of both religious and natural subjects, applied colors made from handmade dyes and produced one of a kind, wearable art. Modern artists are expanding the role of batik by using batik methods to create pictures on canvas incorporating new and exciting motifs. Today, batik fabrics run the gamut of personal taste: from expensive, textured silk sarongs bearing the traditional motifs and handmade colors developed in isolated villages over many generations; to casual day wear featuring pop-art styling and a “tie-dye” color technique. The applications for batik-craft seem to keep expanding as the Western world incorporates batik techniques and motifs into more and more artistic and cultural venues. Batik is one of those crafts which appeal to both the child’s desire to play and create, and the mature artisan’s need to express themselves through a vigorous, exacting art medium. Sample the batik process as practiced by generations of Indonesian families. Our guru will guide you through the process of applying hot wax to a stenciled design on a fabric canvas, then you’ll apply colors to the patterned fabric- and finish the day with your new batik creation to take home with you! We have two slots everyday, a morning slot and an afternoon slot: - Morning Class: 10am - Afternoon Class: 2pm
strTitle: Learn Traditional Batik Painting

strIntroduction: Learn to make traditional herbal drinks (Jamu), Balinese oils, tiger balm, and sun block in Ubud, Bali. Jamu is a traditional herbal medicine from Java that is made of natural ingredients such as plant roots and fruits. In this herbal class, you will learn 4 things during the entire program: 1. How to make Jamu herbal drinks and the medicinal properties or various ingredients. These drinks have a cleansing and slimming effect, and can also be consumed as an energising tonic. 2. How to make Balinese Tiger Balm body scrubs (Boreh). Boreh can be used to exfoliate your skin, stimulate your nervous system, and aid in digestion. 3. How to make Balinese body oil for massaging or hair. This oil calms the body & mind, helps fight infections, and can be used as an aphrodisiac. 4. How to make Balinese sun block which draws out toxins and smoothens the skin. Photo Credits: http://bit.ly/1mxIg8t http://bit.ly/1pqf6wW http://bit.ly/TYUKhO
strTitle: Learn to Make Balinese Oils, Balms and Jamu in Ubud

strIntroduction: This experience offers the rare opportunity to get a beautifully-tailored traditional Balinese outfit made so you can wear it comfortably and express your own personal style! You will feel like real a Balinese local, exquisitely dressed and elegant while wearing your very own custom-made kebaya that is perfectly fitted to you. Our professional and friendly staff will be more than happy to do your make up, making you even more beautiful for your photo shoot in your new kebaya! ITINERARY: DAY 1: 09.30: Pick up at your hotel lobby and drop off at the tailor to take your measurements 10.00: Transfer back to the hotel. DAY 5: 09.30: We’ll pick you up at the hotel lobby and take you to our salon for make-up and hair. The full dress-up experience takes about 1 hour. 10.30: We will then proceed to the temple so you can take part in an offering ceremony and get your photos taken in a local environment. The process will be explained so you understand the significance of each step. To keep these precious memories, we will give you 3 5R-sized photos and a CD of all your photos to print at your own leisure. 12.00: Change back into your own clothes, remove your make up and return to your hotel. NOTE: We have 3 plans your can choose from. The difference between them lies primarily in the quality of the material you choose for your outfit: - Standard plan - Superior plan - Deluxe plan Photo credits: www.flickr.com/photos/me2d/4554072031
strTitle: Tailor-Make Your Own Traditional Balinese Outfit

strIntroduction: When talking about carving, everyone tends to imagine stone carving or wood carving. In Bali, we have another one - fruit carving! The end result looks very beautiful and is easy to make, so everyone can try it. I will be happy to teach you how to create some of the designs, before you make one by yourself (and eat it later of course). The great thing about fruit carving is that you can do it any time, especially when you have a party with your friends. They will be amazed at what they see. These beautiful carvings can also be made for someone as a present. I have been a professional wood carver for many years and have been teaching many people in the past. Join me for this class, and let's make some tasty carvings together!
strTitle: Try Your Hand at Balinese Fruit Carving!

strIntroduction: Bali Food Safari dining tours offer an experience that surprise and engage the senses, taking you and your accompanying guests from your accommodation to an array of mystery venues in one brilliant evening, dining in a selection of the Bali's best restaurants, discovered and undiscovered, exploring the most exceptional and delicious delights Bali has to offer. Adventure with Bali Food Safari in Seminyak, Ubud or Jimbaran with the choice to visit three or four venues for your evening, with a variety of dishes ranging from local cuisine, Italian, tapas and modern dishes. ITINERARY FOR THE NIGHT Starting with Sundown Getting things started with a view of the sun melting into the horizon and watch dusk roll over as you are served dishes at your first venue. Soak up the atmosphere and the dishes before moving to the next venue. Next Venue(s) The next stop(s) will be uncovered over the course of the evening. You’ll experience taste sensations, with each table specially reserved for your Bali Food Safari. Drinks are at the choice of the diners, with payment made to the venue prior to leaving. Ending on a High Your concluding venue serves up fine desserts to sample, with some of the richest and most delicate sweet plates you’ll taste. Heading Home Once your tour is complete, we will return your group to your accommodation. Should you have other plans to keep the night going, simply let us know with enough notice and we can do our best to accommodate. ========================================================= LOCATIONS The Bali Food Safari is run in 3 different regions of Bali. These are Seminyak, Ubud and Jimbaran. VENUES You will visit 4 venues and they will be revealed only on the night! NOTE: If possible, bookings should be placed at least 3 days (72 hours) prior to the scheduled departure time of your tour as we need to coordinate your menu with the restaurants. TIMING AND MEET-UP Upon booking, your desired pick-up location will be noted on the confirmation. We encourage all tour guests to be ready at their accommodation, or collection point, at least 10 minutes prior to departure. The meet-up time and other information is confirmed upon booking and payment of your tour. Please note that there is only one pick-up location per booking - unless previously arranged so. **Arrival at the 1st Venue is at 5:30 pm so please expect pick-up to be somewhere in between 4 to 5 pm depending on your location.** Please let us know of any dietary restrictions beforehand. ========================================================= Some F.A.Q. Q. What is progressive style dining? A. Progressive style dining is simply where you enjoy a number of dishes, each at alternative locations. Bali Food Safari tours collect guests and drive them to each location between dishes. Please note that Bali Food Safari is designed as a sample and introduction to new and exciting flavours and dishes, differing from the traditional set courses of entrée, main and dessert. Q. Will we be informed of which restaurants we will attend on the tour? A. We’re proud of the restaurants Bali Food Safari has partnered with, for both their delicious food and great atmosphere. Part of your tour experience is the mystery and discovery of the venues and scenery as the night unfolds. We keep your hand picked restaurants as a surprise until your tour begins. Q. Does Bali Food Safari include alcohol? A. No. Bali Food Safari tours are a food based tour only. Alcohol can be purchased at any of the restaurants you visit, with guests taking responsibility to settle the bill prior to leaving. No liability will be assumed by Bali food tours for injury caused by alcohol consumption. Q. Can I book for a group? A. Yes. We encourage groups to participate in the Bali Food Safari tours available. We can accommodate groups of up to 10 people. Should you wish to book for more than 10, please contact us over the messaging system. Q. Do I need to bring anything else? A. No. We encourage you to bring your eager taste buds, of course you can bring your own cameras to capture the memories and scenery of your tour. Should you wish to purchase alcoholic beverages you will need to bring a means of payment with you. Q. What should we wear? A. Smart casual (no singlets). All restaurants have a relaxed dress code, as is the joy of Bali holidaying. We encourage you to wear something comfortable, and remember that your tour will be held come rain or shine. Q. Are there any other charges? A. All booking fees include taxes, tour fees, service charges and your culinary discovery. Should you wish to, you’re welcome to purchase your own drinks over the tour. Q. What if I have any other dietary restrictions and allergies? A. Please email us about any allergies, dietary needs or restrictions you may have. Due to the nature of the tour, we cannot guarantee that any dietary needs or restrictions can be accommodated given the nature of Asian cuisine and the variety of restaurants used. We will do our best to work according to your preference. Any and all food allergies and dietary restrictions shall and must be disclosed to Bali Food Safari Tours prior to tour commencement. Q. Can we bring the kids? A. Bali Food Safari tours are designed as an adult activity and as such we don’t encourage any guests under the age of 18. Rather we suggest you take the time out of parenthood to reconnect with your loved one or family and friends. Babysitting services are offered throughout many hotels across Bali.
strTitle: Join Bali Food Safari - A Mystery Dining Adventure

strIntroduction: Whether you've been fortunate enough to be entertained by Jegog playing Balinese musicians or have yet to learn about this authentic Balinese musical instrument, this unique experience allows you to make it, learn to play it and most importantly, bring it home! The tradition of making and playing the Jegog has been passed down from one generation to another among musical guilds in the village of Jembrana, Bali. Its popularity has spread to other parts of Bali over recent years. Each instrument has eight bamboo key base on a four-note scale. Under the guidance of a Jegog master, you will learn to play this traditional Balinese Gamelan instrument in no time. We will pack your Jegog, so you can take it home.
strTitle: Build your own Bamboo Jegog and Learn to Play the Instrument

strIntroduction: Pickup service from Denpasar International Airport. I will be waiting for you at the airport arrival lobby with your name on a placard so you can easily find me once you exit the baggage claim area. Once I pick you up at the airport, you'll be provided with mineral water and a cold towel so you can hydrate and refresh yourself from your journey into Bali. I'll then whisk you away for a comfortable 1 - 1.5 hour ride up to Ubud, where you'll be dropped off at your hotel.
strTitle: Airport Pickup/Transfer to Your Hotel in Ubud

strIntroduction: This half day spa package lives up to its name. Starting with a 90 minute Esalen massage, followed by a body scrub and ozone facial. Break for a healthy two course lunch in the Taksu Terrace Restaurant and then splurge with two therapists giving you a thorough manicure and pedicure. Here is what will make your 6 hours of treatments so special: EsalenTM Massage: Taksu is proud to boast a full staff of EsalenTM certified massage therapists. EsalenTM, a western modality, is known for its slow movement of strokes that flow powerfully and deeply while at the same time are gentle. The longer, slower, flowing strokes work on multiple muscles. Integrative in nature, the strokes move from one part of the body into another, but never forget where they have been. This style speaks to the body to embrace the idea that it is ok to “feel good”. Luxuriate in the EsalenTM rhythm. Aloe Vera Botanical Ozone Facial: Based on a simple, centuries old technique of using steam for deep cleaning of facial pores, modern medicine has now brought the therapeutic powers of gentle ozone steam to create a thoroughly effective, comfortable facial treatment. An ozone facial delivers deepened moisturizing and purification, accelerates skin metabolism and increases blood circulation. Ozone steamers loosen dirt clogged in the pores to rid excessive sebum to clear up acne or blemishes. Try our new ozone facial for a more vibrant, supple face and surprise everyone with your ravishingly gorgeous look. One of the following three Body Scrubs; Salt Glow Body Scrub One of our most popular treatments, sea salt rich in trace minerals is mixed with warm massage oil to exfoliate the top layers of dead skin from the whole body (except for the face). It leaves your skin moist, glowing and satin-smooth. Choose Lavender for calming and relaxing; Lemongrass for refreshing your senses; or Rosemary for stimulating the central nervous system with an anti-aging effect. Galangal & Turmeric Body Scrub Intense and invigorating exfoliating scrubs remove dead skin and boost micro-circulation. Inspired by traditional Indonesian beauty rituals, this scrub leaves skin smooth and refined with a radiant glow. The traditional spices increase blood circulation to stimulate skin regeneration. Coffee & Cinnamon Body Scrub Awaken your natural beauty by taking time to clean, revive and revitalize your skin with a luxuriously pampering scrub. Cinnamon and coffee particles deeply clean skin pores and remove dead cells to leave your skin soft and subtly scented. Coffee awakens your skin’s beauty and cinnamon’s antiseptic qualities helps to keep skin healthy. Sugar Fingers Manicure: A sugar scrub massage and a soothing botanical soak revive and protect skin, leaving it silky smooth. Nail filing, buffing and polish complete the manicure service. Sole Delight Pedicure: Warmed aromatherapy oils nourish and condition your feet and nails, then soak the feet in an exfoliating milk bath, lavish in its richness and healing action on your skin. After the shaping of the nails choose from an array of colors to adorn the feet of a Princess… a sensory experience which promises to leave you walking on cloud nine!
strTitle: Get Pampered in Ubud's Tropical Jungle

strIntroduction: Your experience will start at Abuan Kintamani volcano, from which you will cycle through the beautiful countryside of Bali. You can see orange, jack fruit, chili and cabbage plantations on the way, as well as rice paddies, small villages and Balinese compounds. All of that is the true essence, the real Bali, very hard to see in typical tourist areas.You will be able to experience the Island of Gods with all your senses there. The bike ride is 25 kilometers long and will take approximately 2 to 3 hours depending on your fitness level. The best way is to just ride slowly, appreciating the surroundings. You can stop whenever and wherever you want for as long as you like. We will conclude in Ubud, where you will enjoy an a la carte Belinese menu for lunch.
strTitle: Cycling Adventure from Volcano to Panyangan in Bali

strIntroduction: Step out of your ordinary day and join us at the gallery for an introduction into Balinese Dance. Our experienced teacher will gently guide you and your friends as you learn your first Balinese dance steps. Sample the integrated body movements, hand and facial gestures that make Balinese dance so unusual to new visitors. Our teacher will explain the meaning(s) behind the individual postures and gestures that comprise the basics of Balinese dance. It’s a wonderful way to expand one’s knowledge of the Bali-Hindu culture while enjoying a bit of exercise. We’ll provide the music, the sash and the sarong, so come join us for a few hours of fun! We have two slots everyday, a morning slot and an afternoon slot: - Morning Class: 10am - Afternoon Class: 2pm
strTitle: Learn the Basics of Balinese Dance

strIntroduction: [COMBINATION ONE DAY PACKAGE TO SAVE YOUR TIME AND MONEY] Your day will start with an exciting white water rafting trip at a beautiful river of your choice. You can choose from 2 different locations for the amazing rafting activity. If you want to enjoy a moderate river with a peaceful rainforest view, choose Ayung River in Ubud. If you are looking for a more exciting ride, choose Telagawaja River which is located in Rendang village. After your rafting trip, you will be offered a delicious Indonesian lunch buffet. We will then proceed to our highly rated spa. This 1.5 hour spa treatment is especially prepared for this package which is ideal for post-rafting. Start from a relaxing warm stone full body massage to take away the fatigue then followed by chocolate body scrub to make your skin smooth! Itinerary: 8:00 Pick up at hotel lobby by rafting company’s car *Pick up time is approx. between 7:45 – 8:30 depending on the hotel location. 9:30 Get ready for rafting & safety orientation with guide 10:00 Rafting Activities (Approx 1.5 – 2 hours rafting) 12:00 Shower & get changed & Buffet lunch 13:00 Transfer to selected spa in Sanur area by rafting company’s car 14:30 1.5 hour spa treatment 17:00 Transfer back to your hotel lobby by spa’s car *The itinerary highly depends on the traffic condition of the day. Especially if you choose Telagawaja river, please give at least 1 hour extra from the above itinerary as the location of Telagawaja river is farther. Note that the rafting experience comes with below treatments: - 1.5 Hour Original Stone Massage + Chocolate Body Scrub Package - Aromatherapy foot bath with welcome Drink - 5 minutes - Warm stone full body massage - 50 minutes - Chocolate body scrub - 35 minutes - light snack and herbal tea at spa lounge If you would like to add other treatments, you have below options (subject to treatment room availability at the time). For these, you can book and pay directly at the spa reception. Traditional Asian Facial (1hr) – Rp. 282,000 A refreshing 6-step facial using pure and natural ingredients to enhance the condition and appearance of all skin types.. Balinese Style Reflexology (1hr) – Rp. 262,000 Firm pressure is used to stimulate the reflex points in the feet to bring about deep relaxation and improve blood circulation..
strTitle: 5% OFF One Day Package - White Water Rafting + Spa

strIntroduction: Experience the fastest and most exciting full day cruise in Bali as you discover the magnificent sights of Bali’s three sister islands; Nusa Lembongan, Nusa Penida and Nusa Ceningan. Cruise along towering limestone cliffs dropping straight into the sea, float by the “Hole in the Rock” or the “Manta Point Gate” and beautiful secluded, white sand beaches. Enjoy the absolute best snorkeling Bali can offer in the breathtaking landscapes. Sometimes manta rays, whales or dolphins cruise nearby playing in the water – If you are lucky they might even come in closer to greet us! Ocean Rafting, designed with the highest safety standards and equipped with 750hp, promises an exhilarating day of sightseeing and snorkeling at some of Indonesia’s finest pristine coral reefs. PICK UP AND RETURN TIMES: 09.15 - 09.30: Ubud / Uluwatu / Tanah Lot (return 18.30 - 19.00) 09.30 - 09.45: Seminyak / Legian / Kuta / Tuban / Nusa Dua / Jimbaran / Canggu (return 18.00 - 18.30) 09.45 - 10.00: Sanur (return 17.45 - 18.00) ITINERARY: 10.00 - Arrival to Benoa harbour and select snorkeling gear prior to boarding. 10.30 - Ocean Rafting vessel departs from Benoa harbour. Safety demonstration onboard. Cruising the South coast of Nusa Penida and viewing 300 foot high coastal cliffs. 11.45 - Snorkeling at Crystal Bay or Gamat Bay. 12.30 - Cruise through spectacular Ceningan channel mangroves. Picnic lunch served on board Ocean rafting vessel. 13.15 - Village Tour. 14.00 - Cruise to 2nd snorkeling spot around Lembongan or Penida. 15.00 - Visit our Beach Club at Lembongan to relax at the beach. Option for parasailing. 16.45 - Ocean Rafting departs from the Beach Club. 17.30 - Ocean Rafting vessel arrives to Benoa harbour.
strTitle: 3 Islands Ocean Rafting Cruise - Tour Lembongan & Penida

strIntroduction: Get picture perfect nails for your holiday photos in Bali! We offer 3 different brands of nail polish for manicure/pedicure treatments: OPI, Gelish, and Shellac. All treatments include shaping, tidying, cuticle trimming and buffing the nails prior to nail polish application. All treatments will begin with a traditional foot bath ritual to cleanse your feet.
strTitle: Get Perfect Nails with Manicure Pedicure Treatments

strIntroduction: Select any 3 extreme water sports available in Bali from the list below: - Banana Boat (15 mins) Up to 5 people can ride on the banana boat together so you can enjoy with your friends and family! A banana boat is a long banana-shaped inflatable craft that you can sit on while being pulled by a speedboat. Expect wind in your hair, splashes of sea water, and loads of fun! - Donut Boat (10 mins) A round donut-shaped craft pulled by a speedboat - Flying Fish (5 mins) A watercraft that starts out flat on the water before flying into the air when pulled by a speedboat - Jetski (15 mins) Feel refreshed with high speeds on the sea, as you ride your jet ski and have your very own James Bond moment! An instructor will ride with you at the back of the jet ski for your own safety. Solo rides without an instructor are also available, but please ensure that you have jet ski experience and do note that insurance is not covered in the fee. - Parasail (5 mins) A recreational activity where you will be towed behind a boat while attached to specially designed parachute, The boat then drives off, carrying the parascender into the air. Enjoy a panoramic view of the open skies and wide seas of Bali. - Snorkelling (1 hour) Snorkel through Bali’s beautiful reefs that will amaze your imagination with its plethora of colourful fish and exotic plants. Be fascinated by the wonders of the sea while gliding through the surface of the waters. Feel like one with the aquatic realms surrounding you. Snorkelling is suitable for all ages and abilities, from beginners and young children to advanced swimmers. Those who do not know how to swim can wear a life jacket to help you float. Learning how to breathe through your mouth with the snorkel mask is easy. - Wakeboard (15 mins) One of the most challenging water sport available in Bali. You will be strapped to a board and pulled by a speedboat round the lagoon. Test your stamina, strength, and balance in this water sport challenge! Free pick-up available from Kuta, Seminyak, Legian, Jimbaran, Sanur and Nusa Dua (min. 2person booking)
strTitle: Bali Extreme Water Sports Package

strIntroduction: If you'd like to see a different side of Bali, our cross-cultural weaving programs on one of Bali's sister islands - Nusa Penida - promote fair trade, sustainable tourism and conservation of traditional weaving practices for remote indigenous communities. We have a choice of 3 durations for this trip (please select the correction option while booking) 2 Days / 1 night 3 Days / 2 nights 5 Days / 4 nights During your time on the island, you will be accompanied by English speaking guides and local master weavers will conduct daily workshops of traditional weaving projects, such as: • Hexagonal Split bamboo basket • Pandanus leaf mat • Split bamboo fish trap • Coconut leaf offering techniques The tour is provided at an easy going “island time” pace allowing plenty of time to explore the natural beauty of Nusa Penida, snorkeling magnificent coral reefs, sightseeing and relaxing. Tour guides for exploring the island are available on request. ACCOMMODATION Hotel Accommodation is provided on Nusa Penida Island at Ring Sameton Inn, a comfortable hotel with large rooms, wi-fi, air-conditioning, swimming pool, restaurant and bar. Breakfast is complimentary. Warungs and restaurants are both within easy walking distance from the hotel. TRANSPORT Return transport by Caspla Bali Sea View Fastboat. The boat journey is a 14km Southeast ocean voyage taking approximately 40 mins. On arrival to the island, transport by either motorbike or car to the Ring Sameton Inn will be arranged AVAILABILITY Every day but try to book at least one week in advance
strTitle: Traditional Weaving Tour with Master Weavers on Nusa Penida

strIntroduction: This tour is ideal for those who are interested in really exploring the history and culture of a unique island and who would love to go where few others have travelled. The temple and meditation spots we will visit date back to the 8th century up to the 12th century, and are basically untouched as they are seldom frequented by locals, let alone visitors. These temples have played a significant role in the development of present day Balinese culture, so those history and culture buffs amongst you, they are something VERY special to visit. As background, modern day Bali Hinduism has been formed over the centuries and is a mixture of Buddhism and Hinduism, influenced by practices of the Javanese empire. During this special tour, we will trace the creation of Bali's unique religion - “Hindu Dharma”, whereby three branches flowed into one over the course of 5 centuries. Our day will start at Pondok Penempahan, the home of Bapak Enong Ismail, the Curator of The Sukarno museum Tampaksiring and the leading expert on the recently World Heritage Listed Pakerisan river area. His simple house sits amongst the rice fields on a ridge to the sacred river of Pakerisan; it’s a beautiful place to start our day. He will welcome you with a drink and Balinese cakes while recounting the story of how the Hindus first came to Bail and how that has evolved over time. He is happy to share his work documenting Balinese culture since 1979 and explain the team's efforts to preserve the temples and monuments for future generations. After this insightful discussion with Bapak Enong, we will proceed to the first temple built in Bali after Besakih in the 8th Century. We will then continue to a temple that is both Buddhist and Hindu built in the 10th Century, where we will have lunch prepared for us in the rice fields. In the afternoon we will make our way to an ancient meditation site hidden in the rainforests and carved out of the stone walls, basically untouched since the 10th Century. Here we will be met by a local priest who will conduct a blessing ceremony for us to wish you luck on your onward journeys in life. We will then enjoy a coffee or tea at a local coffee and spice plantation with beautiful scenery overlooking Tampaksiring's garden (the garden of the holy spring water temple). You can try or taste Tampaksiring herbal tea or Bali's famous luwak (or 'civet') coffee. Lastly, we continue to the sacred Siva Temple, where holy spring water emerges from the bottom of a Banyan tree. This temple is one of Bali's most amazing hidden gems, often omitted by guide books that are not aware of its existence. Very few tourists have been allowed to enter these areas, but through the association with Bapak Anong Ismail and his position within the Sukarno centre, the local villages have entrusted us to bring in very limited numbers to these important places in history. NOTE: While the price of this tour is certainly higher than that of others you see in Bali, you will enjoy exclusive access to one of Indonesia's foremost historians and be guided into hidden ancient temples usually restricted to those outside the village. A proportion of your fee also goes directly into preserving these historical monuments. This is a once-in-a-lifetime experience not to be missed. PICKUP AND RETURN TIMES Ubud area : Pickup 09:00, return around 17:00 Kuta, Sanur, Seminyak and Nusa Dua area : Pickup 08:00, return around 18:00
strTitle: Bali Hidden Temples and Cultural Heritage Tour

strIntroduction: Set on the outskirts of Ubud in a beautiful village called Keliki, this delicious picnic luncheon for two is the perfect way to savor a languid afternoon. We pack a delicious box of gourmet treats for you and bring you to our secret picnic spot on a hill overlooking the verdant valley. While taking in the lush greenery surrounding you, tuck into our selection of gourmet treats and home-made goodies. You will have a choice between 2 menus: WESTERN MENU: - Breaded Prawns with bread crumbs and tartar sauce - Crispy Bacon potato salad, served with mixed lettuce , boiled potatoes, mayonnaise, chopped parsley - Grilled Chicken Panini with grilled vegetables, mayonnaise and cheese - Fresh juice, mineral water, soft drinks and beer - Banana pancakes - Fresh fruit skewers INDONESIAN MENU: - Lumpia Goreng - mixed sautéed vegetables with spicy sweet and sour sauce - Gado Gado Bukit cinta - a roulade of mixed vegetables with beancurd, tofu and peanut sauce - Nasi Bakar Bangkiang Sidem - Fried rice wrapped with banana leaves with grilled chicken, fried bean curd, fresh lalapan and sambal bajak - Fresh juice, mineral water, soft drink and beer - Fruit pudding - Fresh fruit slices Downtown Ubud can get a little hectic, but come enjoy this tranquil hideaway and toast to a wonderful time in Bali.
strTitle: Romantic Gourmet Picnic Overlooking the Ubud Valley
