strTitle: 2 Hour Yoga & Massage Therapy Session in Seminyak

strIntroduction: Our 2D/1N retreat starts with a 60 minute massage in our spa pavilion overlooking the beautiful countryside followed by afternoon tea featuring traditional Balinese farmer sweets and delicacies such as Laklak (a rice flour pancake with palm sugar syrup), Godoh (fried banana fritters), boiled peanuts, sweet potatoes, and sweet corn. After a relaxing afternoon at Cepik Villa (you can spend it with a book at our pool!), we serve you our version of the famous Indonesian Rijsttafel - a rice platter surrounded with exquisite side dishes chock full of flavor - before you retreat to your beautifully appointed room for a deep sleep. The next day, celebrate your morning with a healthy breakfast, followed by a memorable walk through the rice paddies and rivers in the area. Our guide will show you the lay of the land, introduce you to local fruits and vegetables, and take you to some of the most breathtaking views of rice terraces and Mount Agung that you can see in Bali. On your way back to the hotel, you will even get to see how the local tile factory makes tiles by hand! Once you are back, a young coconut is served to revive you before you leave, refreshed and ready to tackle the world! ITINERARY: DAY 1: Afternoon: Arrive in Sidemen and check into Cepik Villa (at your own leisure). be welcomed by 15.00: Relax with a 60 minute Balinese traditional massage to ease the tensions away 16.30: Afternoon tea 19.00: Special Rijsttafel Dinner DAY 2: 06.00: Tuck into a healthy, organic breakfast overlooking the countryside 07.00: Start your morning fresh with a scenic 3-hour-long rice paddy and village trekking experience with our local guide. He will lead you to cross some shallow rivers, and take you on a hidden path to discover the best views in the area. You will even visit a local tile factory on the way back and see how they still make them by hand. 12.00: Ready for departure NOTE: The price for this retreat depends on the time of year, so select your option accordingly: High Season: Dec 23 - Jan 10 Peak Season: July 1 - Sept 15 Low season: All other dates MENUS - We are happy to cater for various diets: - Vegan menu for strict vegetarians: sweet potatoes, sauteed vegetables and fruits. - For those looking for a Satvikk diet, we provide calming foor that excludes garlic, onions, shallots and of course meats, poultry and fish. - Our regular breakfast menu includes Indonesian favorites as well as an American breakfast consisting of toast, jam/preserves, honey, two eggs(any style), bacon or sausages, juices and coffee or tea.
strTitle: Spend A Weekend in the Spiritual Village of Sidemen

strIntroduction: In order to help you get the best our of your time in Lombok, we've created a special combination of biking + a car tour in order to help you cover the greatest amount in one day. We have 2 options below: South Lombok (biking + Kuta tour) On this tour you will picked up by your local guide and dropped off just south of Mataram, where you will start biking from Jeranjang village through rice fields and then the river by boat. Next, we continue on to the traditional pottery village of Banyumulek village and then ride to Sukarara village, which will take you about 1 hour max from Banyumulek village. We walk around the village for a break, then continue to Kuta beach if you still energetic. If not, you can hop in a car to experience the beautiful white sand beaches of the area - including the turquoise crescent bay of Mawun beach. North Lombok (biking + waterfall tour) This tour will start from Senggigi. After driving for 1 ½ hours to Tanjung District, passing through Pusuk monkey forest and Tanjung District, you will start your bike tour from Karang kates village and bike through a stunning rice field area. During the tour, you will see most local men and women working together in their fields and you may to stop by the holiest Buddhist site in the north. To end your trip, you will continue to the famous Gangga waterfall before we take a ride back to your hotel after a great day out.
strTitle: Biking/Trekking Combination Tour - Best of Lombok in 1 day!

strIntroduction: A day trip through authentic Balinese villages and some of the most picturesque parts of Bali, this special tour picks up guests in a land rover equipped with picnic baskets with refreshments. The journey leads you away from the main roads and busy highways on to back roads and through authentic villages. First stop is a natural stone quarry where villagers have cut the stone out of a dry river bed for generations. From there the trip continues to an agricultural village where a local family introduce you to the wealth of tropical plants surrounding them, Cacao trees, mangosteens, the native pomelo, coffee and traditional rice fields mingle with the flowering trees. Locally grown coffee and Balinese sweets are served. The guests would be offered a 30 minutes soft trekking through the rice fields after the coffee break. Next stop is a trip high into the mountains through the UNESCO-recognized rice terraces of Jatiluwih, followed by a sumptuous Balinese lunch, served in a rainforest restaurant surrounded by giant bamboo. Enjoy a glass of wine, beer, in the glorious open-air canopy. After lunch, you will visit Batukaru temple, a unique sacred mountain sanctuary and royal temple of Tabanan dynasty. It was founded in 11th century by Empu Kuturan, a great Hindu Sage who established six main temples on the island of Bali. Our Land Rovers and Land Cruisers depart every morning between 8 and 8.45am and bring you back to your hotel around 5pm. Pricing includes: - Morning tea and coffee break at Balinese farm house - Lunch with Balinese specialities at bamboo forest restaurant on the slopes of Mount Batukaru - Soft drinks, wine, beer, tea or Balinese coffee Mineral water during the journey - Visit to an ancient sand stone quarry, a traditional Balinese farm house, an option to go for 30 minutes soft trekking through the rice fields and visit to Batukaru temple Pick up service available from hotels in Kuta, Legian, Seminyak, Jimbaran, Nusa Dua, Pecatu, Sanur, Canggu, Ubud, Tanah Lot
strTitle: Land Rover Tour - Journey to the Secret Soul of Bali

strIntroduction: KINTAMANI VOLCANO & BARONG DANCE TOUR This tour will start at 08:30 and we visit the following locations: • Batubulan Village : Most popular Balinese cultural show, Barong and Keris Dance • Celuk Village : observe silversmith, making fine silver jewelry (in Balinese style) • Kemenuh Village : Wood carving village • Tegalalang : One of the most picturesque rice terraces in Bali • Kintamani : Having lunch while enjoying the beautiful view of Volcanic Mount Batur and Lake Batur • Kayuamba Village : Traditional Bali "Luwak" Coffee Processing, tropical fruit and Spice Garden. • Tirta Empul Temple : Holy Spring Water Temple. OPTIONAL Holy Bathing Ritual at Holy spring water temple, please contact us for details and further arrangement .
strTitle: Full Day Tour: Kintamani Volcano & Ubud's Villages

strIntroduction: Learn the basics of silversmithing using traditional techniques with our master Indonesian silversmiths. This is a great beginners class and an excellent introduction to making silver jewelry. It runs for approximately 3 hours and is a fun, easy-going introduction into the world of jewelry. With the help of our master silversmiths, you will be able to make your very own design into a finished piece and bring it with you to cherish forever. Techniques covered in this class include: - Sawing - Soldering - Stamping - Sanding and polishing - Working with silver
strTitle: Express your Personality in your own Jewelry in Canggu

strIntroduction: Weaving is one of the most learned craft in Indonesia especially in Bali. This is basically the method of creating rugs, clothes, and other pieces using threads from indigenous materials like silk, plant fibers such as pineapple, palm, lontar and many others by using the traditional weaving machine which is the loom. The practice of weaving can be dated back more than centuries ago. In fact in Indonesia, lontar weaving is the most popular. Lontar basically comes from palm genus which is a tall palm tree and natively growing in tropical regions of Africa, Asia and New Guinea. Lontar fibers are used in weaving to produce creative pieces. There are many workshop in Bali that caters lessons in Lontar weaving. Craft Workshop Bali has all the list of available workshops for weaving and we are one of the known facilitators of organizing lontar weaving workshop. Master weavers will assist art enthusiasts throughout the workshop. Students of the workshop are taught different styles of Indonesian weaving: Ikat and Tapis. Tapis is a traditional weaving style originated from Lumpung, Indonesia and the word also refers to the resulting cloth. The style of the woven material are consist of striped naturally-colored cloth intricately embroidered with warped and couched gold-thread. Whereas Ikat is the dyeing and as well weaving technique in Indonesia. This is used to pattern textiles with a wax dye. The patterns are clearly visible in the fabric. Weaving by ikat style can be done slowly that the weaver carefully weaves by adjustment in order to maintain the clarity of the patterns. The lontar weaving in Indonesia has emerged to be a successful industry. With that, weaving cloths is probably the most in demand. Anyone can see how wonderful the weaved clothes are made by creative artisan weavers of Indonesia. We have two slots everyday, a morning slot and an afternoon slot: - Morning Class: 10am - Afternoon Class: 2pm
strTitle: Learn the Art of Balinese Lontar weaving

strIntroduction: This is a full day trip combining the best of culture and heritage of the island, first with a stop to visit Kemenuh village to see the wood carving center, before continuing up to the Batur volcano with its amazing view of Batur lake. We then visit the largest and most sacred Hindu temple in Bali - Besakih mother temple, the core of Bali's spiritual and sacred life with thousands of pilgrims from all over the island every day. After visiting the temple, we continue to Rendang village to take a rest and have lunch at the local restaurant on the top of a cliff. You will get to take in the spectacular scenery of rice paddy fields and the tallest mountain on the island - Mount Agung. Our last stop for the day is Penglipuran village, a traditional village in Bali with a unique social structure and culture. 700m above sea level, the village boasts a cool atmosphere and is said to have been a place of amusement for former kings. All the houses here are beautiful, with identical traditional gates all oriented towards Mount Agung. Experience the serenity, stillness and beauty of the Balinese soul on this journey... ITINERARY: 08.30: Pick up at your hotel 10.00: Visit to Kemenuh to take a look at the woodcarvers' masterpieces 11.00: Leave for Kintamani to view the Batur volcano 12.30: Continue to Besakih temple 13.30: Start to walk up to Besakih temple 15.30: Leave Besakih to Rendang for lunch at a local restaurant. 16.30: Visit Penglipuran village 17.30: Leave the village for your hotel
strTitle: Bali Traditional Village Tour - Penglipuran, Besakih & more

strIntroduction: Join us to experience our 5 star catamaran and service while we whisk you away from Bali to the white sand beaches of Nusa Lembongan Island. == The Itinerary == 7:30am - 8:00am Pickup from your hotel 9:00am - 11:00am Enjoy a light breakfast while sailing to Nusa Lembongan Island 11:00am - 12:30pm Participate in one of the activities that we offer (see below) 12:30pm - 1:30pm Enjoy a poolside lunch at our beach club 1:30pm - 3:00pm Choose to relax by the pool or take part in another round of activities 3:00pm - 5:00pm Depart for Bali, cruise into the sunset with snacks and drinks on board == The Boat / Journey == Our 80ft sailing catamaran is a new boat designed and built to accommodate a variety of luxury cruise events tailored to your needs, whether you're a group of friends, family, or team looking to enjoy a day out on the water! Facilities on the boat include a spacious upper sun deck, protected lounge and bar area, a kitchen, and audio system so that you can play your tunes as you sail into the sun. Fishing rods, snorkeling equipment, and rubber dinghies are also provided on board so that you can create your own water experiences anywhere! Once on board, let our crew take care of you. They'll make sure you're well fed and hydrated with an assortment of pastries, soft drinks, tea & coffee, sliced fruit, cheese and crackers served all day. In addition to that, they can also teach you to fish or you can even learn the basics of sailing from them! == Activities at Nusa Lembongan Island == Banana Boat Rides: What better way to participate in watersports than on a banana boat ride with your friends Snorkeling: Nusa Lembongan is home to vibrant reefs teeming with marine life and full of color. Our snorkeling guide will take you to some nearby reefs to view fish close up in crystal clear water. Lembongan Village and Seaweed Farm Tours: Known for it’s intricate seaweed farms spanning two islands, Nusa Lembongan and Nusa Penida’s main export is seaweed. We'll take you on a journey to see local life on the island and explore the seaweed farms == Boat Specifications == Construction: West System Gross Tonnage: 27 Tonnes Length: 80 ft / 24.4 meters Width: 45.3 ft / 13.8 meters Power: 2 x Yamaha 115 HP Max Speed: 12 knots Crew: 5 People Max Capacity: 45 Passengers Cabins: 5 Toilets: 4 Safety Equipment: Complies with ISM-Code Support: 2 x dinghies 3.5m RUBS with Yamaha 15 and 25 HP Protected central lounge and rear bar area, spacious upper sun deck, large bow trampoline nets, kitchen, library, toilets, fishing rods, snorkel equipment, audio system
strTitle: Private Sailing Charter Bali to Nusa Lembongan for 12 people

strIntroduction: The trek will start at Dalem Bukit Buung temple, and we will then walk through the village. Along the way we’ll see the typical countryside culture, the green landscape accompanied by bird sounds. And soon the landscape will be more open when we enter agricultural land dominated by rice fields. We may also see a farmer taking care of his cow who will offer us young coconuts. After 3 hours of walk we will be back to the main road. Our car will be waiting there for drive to a Balinese home for getting Balinese lunch. PICK UP TIMES: Ubud area: 08.30 to 08.45 Sanur area: 07.45 to 08.00 Kuta/Seminyak area: 07.30 to 07.45 Nusa Dua / Jimbaran area: 07.15 to 07.30 RETURN TIMES (for private transfers) Ubud: 12.00 Sanur: 12.30 Kuta: 12.45 Jimbaran: 13.00 Nusa Dua: 13.15 Uluwatu: 13.45 Note: non-private transfer return times are less accurate as we may need to drop other guests off.
strTitle: Trek in Bali's Rice Fields

strIntroduction: Pickup service from Denpasar International Airport. One of our handpicked drivers will be waiting for you at the airport arrival lobby with your name on a placard so you can easily find them once you exit the baggage claim area. Once your driver picks you up at the airport, you'll be provided with mineral water and a cold towel so you can hydrate and refresh yourself from your journey into Bali. All you have to do is sit back, relax and enjoy the comfortable 30-45 minute to Kuta where you will be dropped off at your hotel.
strTitle: Private Arrival Transfer to/from Your Kuta or Jimbaran Hotel

strIntroduction: This is a two day tour starting from your hotel in the morning , and ending the next day in late afternoon or evening. We will search for king cobras and other wildlife, including porcupines, birds, other snakes, lizards and civet cats First we visit our depot to see any reptiles that we have rescued that week plus any snakes that require hospitalisation or treatment. Then, its off to find king cobras in Western Bali. The travel takes between two and four hours depending on which locations we visit first. After enjoying the afternoon searching, we will book into a hotel and get ready to spend the evening hunting for both kings and other wildlife. Next morning, its back looking for kings again before heading home. These tours are designed for both keen wildlife lovers and also for people who have never even seen wildlife before Nowhere else on Earth gives the opportunity to get up close and personal with wild king cobras like we can. So far we have never missed out on finding at least one wild king on these tours This is because we know the locations of the hunting areas and nesting sites of several kings now and our guides are the best in the business . King Cobra country is usually jungle with bamboo thickets and plenty of running water, so a reasonable level of fitness is required.
strTitle: Trek to Search for King Cobras and Other Wildlife (2D/1N)

strIntroduction: Whatever your experience level or age, come experience the fun of creating something from your imagination! In this workshop, I will show you various techniques in hand building ceramics before letting you have free reign on the potter's wheel. The studio is yours during this time to express your creativity, so bring your family and friends to join me as you create a souvenir of your time here. We have two time slots available for this ceramics class: a morning class from 9:30am -12:30pm and an afternoon class from 1:30am - 4:30pm. During the three hour session, you will be able to make approx. 3-6 pieces, including cups, mugs, bowls, plates. You will also be able to paint them any way you'd like! We will need about 3 weeks to finish your pottery in our ovens but can arrange for shipping afterward, so come on by.
strTitle: Try your Hand at Ceramics with Suzan

strIntroduction: Babi Guling is a traditional Balinese roasted pig. It's delicious and you should definitely try all of the different parts of it. It's easy to get one anywhere in Bali! But how about MAKING your own Bali Guling? This would be a truly unique experience! You can do it real Balinese style, with catching the pig yourself at the sty, killing it and cleaning it, or it can be done for you. What you will do for sure is prepare and roast the pig with the help of a local. The process is very traditional, but the final food is completely safe to eat, since the pig is roasted. It's impossible to eat the whole pig at one time, even with several people, so you can of course take as much as you want back with you, to eat the next day. You will be amazed how much better Babi Guling tastes if you were preparing the pig yourself!
strTitle: Learn to Prepare Balinese Roasted Pig (Babi Guling)

strIntroduction: If you find yourself in Bali on Galungan, the Balinese holiday celebrating the victory of good over evil, you will likely encounter rows upon rows of intricately decorated bamboo poles lining the streets (some over 10m in height!). These spectacularly decorated poles are called 'penjor', and they are erected outside homes and along the streets as an offering to thank the Gods for the fruits of the earth. Each family decorates their penjor differently, with many of them gathering together in their compound the day before Galungan to piece together the various components that make up this majestic offering. Everything from the beautiful woven palm leaf offering swaying at its apex to the small cage made from bamboo has a special meaning. The Balinese traditional compounds come alive on these special occasions and we want to give you the chance to experience this no matter what time of year you come to Bali. By preparing all the young coconut leaves or 'busung', we will be ready to show you how to form patterns with these leaves so you can gain a deeper appreciation for these unique structures. My mother and grandmother are particularly gifted at making these special offerings, so come learn from them and see the experts at work! ITINERARY: 07.30 - 08.00: Pick up from your hotel 08.30: Arrival at our home. We will explain the meaning of the penjor and show you the different parts of it and what each part's function and meaning is. The first component we will make is called 'cili', which is the hanging portion of it. We will show you how to make 'reringgitan' - the decoration along the pole. Finally we teach you how to make the base 10.30 - 12.30: Complete the individual parts and start assembling it onto the pole 12.30: Break for simple local lunch 13.30: We gather the villagers to help us install the penjor and place it upright. All in all, you will learn to make 6 different patterns. This is a great activity for families, friends and even team-building PICK UP TIMES Sanur/Ubud: 08.00 Kuta/Legian/Seminyak Jimbaran/Nusa Dua: 07.30
strTitle: Learn to Make a Penjor like a Local

strIntroduction: Join us and explore the untouched Balinese jungle through our jungle trekking experience as well as travel through the Sacred Tamblingan lake in our traditional dugout canoe (20 minute ride)! Get away from the crowds and madness and immerse yourself in nature. With our knowledgable guides, you'll learn about Bali's natural environment, the ecosystem that exists within it, Bali's sacred history and our culture when you enter the unique temple within the jungle. Our guides have plenty of interesting stories to share with you! You might even get the chance to spot some of our bird life. Our friendly local guides are very familiar with Balinese culture and local history and will be more than happy to answer any of your questions during the journey. Rest assured that we guarantee your safety throughout the trip too. Whatever your age and fitness level, you are more than welcomed to join us. We make sure that the pace is at a suitable level for you and do inform our guides whenever you feel the need to stop. This jungle trekking experience is aimed to provide you with a peaceful and informative experience. ITINERARY: 10am - Arrive at Start Point 10.30am - Start the Jungle Trek 12.30pm - Arrive at End point and enjoy a delicious lunch We will drop you back at your hotel after lunch Pick Up Times - Nusa Dua: 07:00AM - Kuta: 07:30AM - Sanur: 08:00AM - Ubud: 09:00AM
strTitle: Go Jungle Trekking and Sit in a Traditional Canoe

strIntroduction: Wake boarding, or waterskiing, is one of the most challenging water sports available in Bali. You will be strapped to a board and pulled by a speedboat round the lagoon. Test your stamina, strength, and balance in this water sport challenge! Free pick-up available from Sanur, Kuta, Legian, Seminyak, Nusa Dua & Jimbaran Area (Min. 2 Person Booking)
strTitle: Try Wakeboarding in Bali!

strIntroduction: Looking for a reliable driver to go sightseeing on your next Bali trip? From exploring a culture that is centuries old to marvelling at gorgeous beaches, Bali offers something for everyone. On this 10 hour free-style tour, I want to give you complete flexibility to plan your perfect day with me. Bali may has a multitude of guides, but rest assured that I have the experience and knowledge to help make your trip unforgettable... Depending on what your party is interested in, we can visit art festivals to take in the music and dances of Bali or explore its many temples, palaces and picturesque hillsides. We can even climb a magnificent volcano to enjoy a spectacular sunrise or sunset, or simply sit back and enjoy a relaxing massage that Bali is so famous for. If your party is feeling energetic, I can arrange for various activities including white water rafting, diving and snorkeling, jet skiing and parasailing. I can even bring you to play a round or two of golf. This 10-hour free-style tour will give you and your friends or family complete flexibility! We can go anywhere you'd like and do anything you would like to do.
strTitle: Visit Bali's Famous Sites with an Experienced Bali Guide

strIntroduction: Bali, even though being relatively small island, has so many different places to visit! We offer you a whole day tour, where you can visit things of your own choice. You will talk with you guide and decide where to visit. He is a local person, who knows everything about the island. Not only main tourist attractions, but also many hidden spots and jewels. He can take you to many rural spots, with breathtaking views or points of interest you never knew about. Our driver speaks English and will tell you many interesting facts and trivia about places you will be passing by. He is not only a driver, but he is also passionate about cultural exchange and talking with foreign people, so you can share a lot of stories and thoughts during your day! This tour is a perfect experience, if you want to see all the diversity of Bali!
strTitle: Create your own Bali Experience!

strIntroduction: My activity will make you feel closer to Bali’s rich culture. My "Be Balinese Tour" is not just a tour, as it gives you the chance to be a local Balinese (or at least feel like one for a day). The tour is flexible based on your interests. Suggested itinerary: A. UBUD AND VOLCANO TOUR 1. Batubulan Village : To see the most popular Balinese cultural show with the Barong and Keris Dance 2. Ubud Art Villages (Mas Village for wood carving, Celuk for Silver smithing, Batuan for painting) 3. Mount Batur and Lake Batur (Semi-active Volcano known as Global Geopark Network in 2012) 4. Bali Pulina organic spices and Luwak Coffee Tasting with scenic rice field and Sebatu Valey view 5. Tegalalang Rice Field: The most scenic rice terraces in Bali with its unique irrigation system called Subak 6. Optional: Monkey Forest Road/Ubud Market (a visit to either the Monkey Forest for the cheeky long tail monkeys, or a stroll around the market) 7. Optional: GoaGajah Temple/Tirta Empul B. Tegalalang Rice Field: The most scenic and famous rice field in Bali, known for its irrigation system called Subak 4. Gunung Kawi : Royal Monument from the late 11th Century. 5. BaliPulina and Organic spices plantation: to tasting the most unique coffee in the world called Luwak Coffee 6. Drive through Laplapan Village (a beautiful and scenic back road famous for its eco cycling track) 7. GoaGajah Temple : Known as Elephant Cave Temple 8. Ubud Art Villages (Optional) C. ELEPHANT SAFARI RIDE AND TANAH LOT 1. Ubud Monkey Forest : Most popular Balinese cultural show with the Barong and Keris Dance 2. Taro Safari Elephant Park (The most recommended Elphant Park in Bali) 3. Ubud Countryside : Drive through Kutuh Village to see the real Ubud that's too often missed by visitors to Bali 4. Tegalalang Rice Field: The most scenic and famous rice field in Bali, known for its irrigation system called Subak 5. BaliPulina and Organic spices plantation: to tasting the most unique coffee in the world called Luwak Coffee 6. Mengwi: The Royal Family Garden and Temple ( A world heritage site stated by UNESCO on July 6th, 2012) 7. Optional: Tanah Lot for the most beautiful sunset in Bali D. WHITE WATER RAFTING AND TANAH LOT 1. Ayung River for White Water Rafting 2. Ubud Countryside : Drive through Kutuh Village to see the real Ubud that's too often missed by visitors to Bali 3. Tegalalang Rice Field: The most scenic and famous rice field in Bali, known for its irrigation system called Subak 4. BaliPulina and Organic spices plantation: to tasting the most unique coffee in the world called Luwak Coffee 5. Mengwi: The Royal Family Garden and Temple ( A world heritage site stated by UNESCO on July 6th, 2012) 6. Tanah Lot for the most beautiful sunset in Bali E. UBUD AND TANAH LOT 1. Batubulan Village : To see the most popular Balinese cultural show with the Barong and Keris Dance 2. Ubud Art Villages (Mas Village for wood carving, Celuk for Silver smithing, Batuan for painting) 3. BaliPulina and Organic spices plantation: to tasting the most unique coffee in the world called Luwak Coffee 4. Tegalalang Rice Field: The most scenic and famous rice field in Bali, known for its irrigation system called Subak 5. MonkeyForest / Ubud Market 6. Mengwi: The Royal Family Garden and Temple ( A world heritage site stated by UNESCO on July 6th, 2012) 7. Tanah Lot for the most beautiful sunset in Bali F. WATER SPORTS AND SOUTH BALI IN A DAY 1. Tanjung Benoa Beach: aquatic adventure - jet ski, parasailing, banana boat, diving, snorkling etc 2. Nusa Dua Area : Water Blow, 5* Resort Area in Bali, DevdanShow (Optional) 3. Padang Padang Beach: Beautiful beach in the area of Uluwatu - a great surfing point. 4. Uluwatu Temple : Built in the 11th century and set on a cliff bank with a stunning view of the Indian view 5. Kecak Dance : Must-see Bali dance performed at Uluwatu Temple at sunset overlooking Uluwatu Temple and the Indian Ocean beyond 6. Jimbaran Bay: Enjoy a freshly-grilled seafood dinner at one of the best beaches in Bali G. BALI WORLD HERITAGE SITES 1. Mengwi: The Royal Family Garden and Temple ( A world heritage site stated by UNESCO on July 6th, 2012) 2. Bedugul : Enjoy a beautiful botanical garden with various collection of plants 3. Lake Beratan : Famous for its lake temple called Pura Ulundanu Beratan 4. Jatiluwih Rice Terraces: Famous for its Subak irrigation system that has been recognised as a UNESCO World Heitage site since 2012 5. Tanah Lot for the most beautiful sunset in Bali H. TANAH LOT AND ULUWATU 1. Taman Ayun Temple : A Royal Family Garden and Temple (Stated as a UNESCO world heritage in 2012) 2. Tanah Lot Temple . By wearing the local Balinese dress its mean i am authentic local balinese tour guide and driver. Join me and become a Balinese!
strTitle: Discover Bali's Sights with Local Balinese Tour Guide

strIntroduction: If you walk around Bali, you will notice many locals wearing beautiful printed cloth boasting bright colours. These traditional clothes, called Batik, are traditionally made using a manual wax-resist dyeing technique and each region often has its own unique pattern. During this 3 hour class, you will work with expert craftsmen who will teach you the process, help you create a beautiful peace of art by applying different colour patterns to cloth and using wax to create your design. You can witness how the masters do it and express yourself. It is a hit with both adults and children! After the Batik class, you will be taken for a quick jaunt to one of Ubud's sacred sites, the monkey forest, which houses over 600 long-tailed macaques. These cheeky creatures are great fun to watch and you can take a leisurely stroll through this lush green forest. It is a great place to take pictures. Before returning to your hotel, we want to take you on a short drive through the country side to visit the Tegalalang rice terrace - considered one of the most beautiful rice terraces in Bali thanks to its contoured shapes. You will love the view.
strTitle: Design and Make your own Batik

strIntroduction: I was born in Gambih village in Payangan district. It's a small, remote place in Bali. Most of the community there are farmers, wood carvers, or builders. Balinese farmers must join the local Subak. Subak means Rice Growers Association. It ensures that water reaches all the paddies so whoever's field is at the bottom is usually elected to lead the organization since if his field has water, that means everyone above him has it too. Gambih area is a real Bali place - very untouched, full of beautiful views, stunning landscapes, rice terraces and exotic plantations. You can observe all of the normal, daily activities - milking cows, cutting grass, etc. Go together with me and you will be able to see all that. You will also be able to experience real Balinese culture, like learning to make Balinese hat and listening to Balinese bamboo music, or climbing coconut tree to pick fresh young coconut. Drinking from this coconut during lunch, with fried rice, chicken satay and absolutely delicious fried banana for dessert. You will also be able to see Balinese cock fighting. There is no betting involved and animals are not doing real harm to each other, it's more or an attraction nowadays. Cock fighting is a regular feature during temple ceremony - combination of sacrifice sport and gambling. I think you cannot get deeper, if you want to see real Bali. It's a wonderful experience, full of fun things to do, great views and loving people. Don't miss it!
strTitle: Visit my Hometown and Experience real Bali

strIntroduction: Come join us on this herbal walk to: - Familiarize yourself with a wide range of native plants and herbs - Learn to identify herbs by sight, smell, and taste - Gain insight into the techniques and practices of traditional and contemporary Balinese herbal healing - Explore various methods for diagnosing and treating common ailments - Learn how you can interpret various plants effects for individual constitution - Be Introduced to the plants that are used for first aid, emergencies and the treatment of chronic illnesses Balinese people have maintained our ancient relationship to the natural world. It is an integral part of our life and culture. For centuries Balinese have used a wide range of native plants & herbs for therapeutic, medicinal & health enhancing purposes. This herb walk is a unique opportunity to explore the prolific plant life that flourishes here. The herb walk takes about 3.5 hours, including a short break at an organic restaurant. In addition to discovering herbs that grow along the edges of the sawahs, you will learn about the methods that the farmers use to cultivate rice and about the rich history & culture of farming in Bali. Although it doesn’t seem obvious how ownership of the farmlands are established, narrow Subak irrigation channels and different ground levels apparently delineate who owns what patch of land. Lilir believes it is crucial for young people to spend time working in the rice fields to get a feel for their land and to learn how they are connected to it. Unfortunately, many are reluctant to embrace the old ways when new technology beckons. Similarly, when it comes to treatment of ailments, most young people seek cures through modern medicines, eschewing traditional methods. Come learn the traditional way with us.
strTitle: Learn About, Find, and Pick Healing Herbs in Bali

strIntroduction: Free-diving is not just a sport of super men or the aquatically gifted; it is an accessible journey of self discovery open to just about anyone with curiosity and a willingness to learn. Scientific research and the efforts of the elite free-diving community in recent years have led to great improvements in understanding the physiological processes of breath hold diving. The resulting improvement in training techniques means that even people with limited aquatic experience will be amazed what they can learn in just a couple of days. Furthermore, we combine this with yoga. Yoga is for everyone, not just the strong and flexible. That is our starting premise. We also believe all styles of yoga have some merit and this is reflected in the yoga we teach here, which draws on many traditions. We take an emphasis on alignment from Iyengar and some accessible principles of posture from Anusura. We also bring in some of the flow of Ashtanga Vinyasa and a Tantric awareness of subtler aspects of asana that is influenced by the Bihar School of Yoga and Qi gong. We offer a full 2 day beginner's course, which allows you to develop your aquatic abilities, and lets you relax in the picturesque town of Amed. === About the Introductory Freediving 2 Day Course === This two day course is a good general introduction to free-diving for anyone interested in developing their aquatic ability. From people with a lot of experience in the water to those with almost none this course is an important introduction to the silent world of Apnea diving in the tropical waters around Amed, Bali. Even those with considerable skin diving experience will benefit as the focus of the course is on developing good free-diving technique and laying the foundation for effective and safe further training. The theory will be given in a beautiful beach-side training space and on the vibrant coral reefs of Jemeluk Bay, East Bali. The theory of the basic free-diver course gives a solid understanding of the processes involved in breath hold diving and how to develop good dive technique to make most efficient use of O2. Through awareness of the body’s physiological processes the student will learn to how to prepare both the mind and the body with a pre-dive breathe up and move through the water in an effective manner. They will practice constant weight with fins and free immersion dives on a line to maximum depth of 20 metres. They will also establish themselves in good safety procedure, learning recovery breaths and rescue techniques so that they can continue to train safely in their own time. Day 1 – Jemeluk Wall 09.00 - Dry Training: Correct mental and physical techniques, yogic breathing, physics of pressure, equalisation, pre-dive 12.00 - Open Water Training: Aquatic awareness, duck dive, fin stroke, using a line, free immersion and constant weight fin dives to a maximum of 15 meters, recovery breathing Day 2 – Jemeluk Wall 09.00 - Dry Training: Revision, buddy training, safety aspects and rescue techniques 12.00 - Open Water Training: Free immersion, constant weight dives to a maximum of 20 metres, safety diving, in water rescue, surface rescue === About Jemeluk Bay & Amed: Our Training Space === Welcome to the other Bali, where the pace is slow, the locals are friendly and the landscape is stunning. On one side there’s paddy fields and lush green hills reaching up to the beautiful Mt Agung volcano, a place of astounding physical beauty, perfect for studying yoga. On the other side we have Jemaluk Bay, our deep blue playground. With coral walls, bountiful marine life, little or no currents and black sand beaches it has excellent conditions for free-diving. Our training space is built right on the beach in the small village of Jemaluk on the spectacular Amed coast of East Bali. On top of having the best spot for freediving training in Bali, Jemaluk is also just 12 km from Tulamben, home of the famous USS Liberty wreck (where we dive during the advanced free-diving course). When not at our training space, we often do static training at the stunning water palace at Tirtta Ganga or free-dive at the famous ‘USS Liberty’ wreck, 110 metres long and lying in between 5 mts to 30 mts depth. This is the perfect place to practice your new free-diving skills. The wreck is an underwater wonderland of marine life – schools of trevally, bream, fusilier and anthias mill all over and around the wreck, coming curiously right up to the free-diver. Batfish, large sweetlips, angelfish, butterfly fish and anemone fish are abundant. Lionfish, scorpionfish, hawkfish, bumphead parrot fish, pufferfish and coral trout are everywhere – as are the gobies, blennies, shrimps and dottyback out on the sand flats. The wreck is brimming with life, with safe overhead environments and exciting swim-throughs. It’s a free-divers paradise, the perfect site to practice free-diving for the sheer pleasure of the silent underwater experience.
strTitle: Intro to Freediving in Amed, Bali

strIntroduction: Komodo Island and Rinca Island are the home of this large powerful lizard, the Komodo Dragon. In this experience, you will be able to join a guided tour to Komodo Island and Rinca Island to see and walk with Komodo Dragons. We do these extended tours because we understand that you go to Komodo to see dragons and we want to maximise you time with them Our guides are the best in the region, and our guests never leave disappointed. ITINERARY: - We will pick you up at the airport in Labuan Bajo, Flores, and take you to the waiting boat. - First stop to Rinca Island to see the Komodos. - Sleep aboard the boat and visit beaches and reefs along the way for swimming and snorkelling. - Off to Komodo Island to see more Komodo Dragons. - Sleep on board again and after swimming in the morning. - Return to Labuan Bajo to catch your return flight.
strTitle: Walk With Komodo Dragons on a Komodo Island Tour (3D2N)

strIntroduction: Standing at an impressive 3,727 metres, Mount Rinjani (Indonesia's 2nd highest volcano) offers visitors a once-in-a-lifetime adventure experience. As one of the most established and reputable companies leading Mount Rinjani treks (you can ask around and everyone knows Ronie!), we guarantee you a fantastic experience with our own knowledgeable guides (all trained in search and rescue) who stay with you from start to finish. There is NO handing off to local mountain guides like other companies who might try to speak to you in the local tourist area. Depending on the amount of time you have on your trip, you can conquer the mountain over different time periods, ranging from 2 days/1 night to 4 days/3 nights. We also provide 3 levels of service depending on your budget, which differ based on the thickness of the mattress we bring up, toilet facilities and the food provided. During our nights and days together, our team will cook you delicious breakfast, lunch and dinner and we'll even have cosy campfires with sing-a-longs. After all the time we spend together, many of our guests come back to see us and retell stories of our time on the mountain. If you choose to climb Rinjani with us, we know you'll make friends for life and have an unforgettable experience with the majesty of nature. ITINERARIES: 2D/1N Trek to Rim: Day 1 - Senggigi-->Senaru-->Rim I (Crater Senaru) -Start at 5.30am, drive to Senaru village for breakfast (2h) -Trek through pristine rain forest and see wildlife (3h) -Reach base camp 2 for lunch, a hearty bowl of mountain soup prepared by porters -Trek to base camp 3 (2h) -Set up camp for overnight stay on Crater Senaru (first rim) Day 2 - Rim I-->Senaru Village-->Senggigi -Enjoy early morning sunrise and breakfast -Descent for Senaru Village at 8am -Transport will be waiting for you to bring you back to your hotel before 5pm NOTE: A 2D/1N Trek to the Summit is also available, we will trek to Crater Sembalun instead of Crater Senaru) *********************** 3D/2N Trek: Day 1 - Senggigi-->Sembalun-->Rim II (Sembalun crater) -Start at 5.30am, drive to Sembalun village for breakfast (2h) -8.30am Trek through the savannah and see wildlife. Lunch enroute (3h) -Set up camp for overnight stay on Crater Sembalun (first rim) Day 2 - Rim II-->Summit-->Lake (Segara Anak) -Commence climb to the summit of Mt Rinjani at 3am (3h) -Photographs and enjoy the spectacular panoramic view -Descend back to Sembalun crater for breakfast -Descend down to Segara Anak Lake -Enjoy sauna and hot springs in natural spring water, temperature around 40 degrees -Lunch prepared by porter -Ascent to Rim I (Senaru Crater) at 3pm (2). Set up camp for overnight stay. Day 3 - Rim I-->Senaru-->Senggigi -Enjoy early morning breakfast and sunrise -Descent to Senaru village, arrive at 12nn -Transport will be waiting for you to bring you back to your hotel before 3pm *********************** 4D/3N Trek: Day 1 - Senggigi-->Sembalun-->Rim II (Sembalun crater) -Start at 5am, drive to Sembalun village for breakfast (2h) -8.30am Trek through the pristine rainforest and see wildlife. Lunch enroute (3h) -Set up camp for overnight stay on Crater Sembalun (first rim) Day 2 - Rim II-->Summit-->Lake (Segara Anak) -Commence climb to the summit of Mt Rinjani at 3am (3h) -Photographs and enjoy the spectacular panoramic view -Descend back to Sembalun crater for lunch -Trek down to Lake Segara Anak (3-4h) -Set up camp for overnight stay and go fishing Day 3 - Lake-->Rim I (Senaru Crater) -Breakfast and sightseeing at Segara Anak Lake -Enjoy the hot spring pool and explore steaming milk caves. Lunch prepared by porter during your sauna -Ascend to Senaru Crater at 3pm. Set up camp for overnight stay. Day 4 - Rim I-->Senaru Village-->Sengigi -Breakfast of pancakes or scrambled eggs with toast while you enjoy the sunrise -Set off towards Senaru village, reach around 12nn -Transport will be waiting for you to bring you back to your hotel before 3pm *********************** BUDGET SERVICE Facilities: : Tent, Sleeping bag, mattress, cooking utensils Fruits: banana and pineapple Drinks: aqua water, coffee and tea anytime Snacks: Wafer, biscuit, Tim Tam, gabin. Breakfast -Corn Flakes/Cereal - Pancakes - Toast with scramble Egg - Egg Sandwiches - Spring rolls or fried bananas - Fruit salad Lunch -Beef sandwich + fried potatoes -Spaghetti -Fried rice with fried chicken -Fried / soup noodle with boiled egg -Fruit Salad Dinner -Rice with chicken curry -Rice with cap cay and fried chicken - Steam Rice with gado gado ( Veg with peanut sauce )+ Tofu + boiled egg + boiled potatoes - Steam Rice with vegetable and mushroom soup + fried chicken - Fried rice + fried egg - Fruit Salad ********************** All packages include: - Licensed and experienced guides and porters - search and rescue trained - Free internet in our Office - Rinjani Trekking Club Certificate - Safety luggage storage - All Camping Equipment (Tent, Sleeping Bag, mattress, Toilet tent for deluxe service) - Meals (Western and Indonesian food) and drinks (Aqua water, coffee, tea, milk ) - Pick Up service from Airport (from ferry harbor or any other place, there will be an extra charge of US $10/pax) ********************** All packages EXCLUDE: - Gunung Rinjani National Park Entrance fees - All meals except those indicates in the trekking program - Porterage fee for personal backpacks / luggage's - Tips & gratuities to guide & porter - Personal travel insurance, pre-trip medical immunizations - All expenses of a personal nature NOTE: Starting 2017, the Rinjani National park entrance fee is IDR 150.000,- / day /person.
